docs.text: additional_info OPT Description: Information that doesn't fit anywhere else. Can also be used to propose new entries for fields with controlled vocabulary range: String Example: None alkalinity OPT Description: Alkalinity, the ability of a solution to neutralize acids to the equivalence point of carbonate or bicarbonate range: String Example: 50 milligram per liter None alkalinity_method OPT Description: Method used for alkalinity measurement range: String Example: titration None ammonium OPT Description: Concentration of ammonium in the sample range: String Example: 1.5 milligram per liter None api OPT Description: API gravity is a measure of how heavy or light a petroleum liquid is compared to water (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/API_gravity) (e.g. 31.1¬∞ API) range: String Example: None aromatics_pc OPT Description: Saturate, Aromatic, Resin and Asphaltene¬†(SARA) is an analysis method that divides¬†crude oil¬†components according to their polarizability and polarity. There are three main methods to obtain SARA results. The most popular one is known as the Iatroscan TLC-FID and is referred to as IP-143 (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturate,_aromatic,_resin_and_asphaltene) range: String Example: None asphaltenes_pc OPT Description: Saturate, Aromatic, Resin and Asphaltene¬†(SARA) is an analysis method that divides¬†crude oil¬†components according to their polarizability and polarity. There are three main methods to obtain SARA results. The most popular one is known as the Iatroscan TLC-FID and is referred to as IP-143 (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturate,_aromatic,_resin_and_asphaltene) range: String Example: None basin OPT Description: Name of the basin (e.g. Campos) range: String Example: None benzene OPT Description: Concentration of benzene in the sample range: String Example: None calcium OPT Description: Concentration of calcium in the sample range: String Example: 0.2 micromole per liter None chloride OPT Description: Concentration of chloride in the sample range: String Example: 5000 milligram per liter None density OPT Description: Density of the sample, which is its mass per unit volume (aka volumetric mass density) range: String Example: 1000 kilogram per cubic meter None depos_env OPT Description: Main depositional environment (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Depositional_environment). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field range: String Example: Continental - Alluvial None diss_carb_dioxide OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved carbon dioxide in the sample or liquid portion of the sample range: String Example: 5 milligram per liter None diss_inorg_carb OPT Description: Dissolved inorganic carbon concentration in the sample, typically measured after filtering the sample using a 0.45 micrometer filter range: String Example: 2059 micromole per kilogram None diss_inorg_phosp OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved inorganic phosphorus in the sample range: String Example: 56.5 micromole per liter None diss_iron OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved iron in the sample range: String Example: None diss_org_carb OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved organic carbon in the sample, liquid portion of the sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid range: String Example: 197 micromole per liter None diss_oxygen_fluid OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved oxygen in the oil field produced fluids as it contributes to oxgen-corrosion and microbial activity (e.g. Mic). range: String Example: None ethylbenzene OPT Description: Concentration of ethylbenzene in the sample range: String Example: None field OPT Description: Name of the hydrocarbon field (e.g. Albacora) range: String Example: None hc_produced OPT Description: Main hydrocarbon type produced from resource (i.e. Oil, gas, condensate, etc). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field range: String Example: Gas None hcr OPT Description: Main Hydrocarbon Resource type. The term "Hydrocarbon Resource" HCR defined as a natural environmental feature containing large amounts of hydrocarbons at high concentrations potentially suitable for commercial exploitation. This term should not be confused with the Hydrocarbon Occurrence term which also includes hydrocarbon-rich environments with currently limited commercial interest such as seeps, outcrops, gas hydrates etc. If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field range: String Example: Oil Sand None hcr_fw_salinity OPT Description: Original formation water salinity (prior to secondary recovery e.g. Waterflooding) expressed as TDS range: String Example: None hcr_geol_age OPT Description: Geological age of hydrocarbon resource (Additional info: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Period_(geology)). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field range: String Example: Silurian None hcr_pressure OPT Description: Original pressure of the hydrocarbon resource range: String Example: None hcr_temp OPT Description: Original temperature of the hydrocarbon resource range: String Example: 150-295 degree Celsius None lithology OPT Description: Hydrocarbon resource main lithology (Additional information: http://petrowiki.org/Lithology_and_rock_type_determination). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field range: String Example: Volcanic None magnesium OPT Description: Concentration of magnesium in the sample range: String Example: 52.8 micromole per kilogram None misc_param OPT Description: Any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here range: String Example: Bicarbonate ion concentration;2075 micromole per kilogram None nitrate OPT Description: Concentration of nitrate in the sample range: String Example: 65 micromole per liter None nitrite OPT Description: Concentration of nitrite in the sample range: String Example: 0.5 micromole per liter None organism_count OPT Description: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) Should also be provided. (example: total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qpcr) range: String Example: total prokaryotes;3.5e7 cells per milliliter;qPCR None organism_count_qpcr_info OPT Description: If qpcr was used for the cell count, the target gene name, the primer sequence and the cycling conditions should also be provided. (Example: 16S rrna; FWD:ACGTAGCTATGACGT REV:GTGCTAGTCGAGTAC; initial denaturation:90C_5min; denaturation:90C_2min; annealing:52C_30 sec; elongation:72C_30 sec; 90 C for 1 min; final elongation:72C_5min; 30 cycles) range: String Example: None owc_tvdss OPT Description: Depth of the original oil water contact (OWC) zone (average) (m TVDSS) range: String Example: None oxy_stat_samp OPT Description: Oxygenation status of sample range: String Example: aerobic None permeability OPT Description: Measure of the ability of a hydrocarbon resource to allow fluids to pass through it. (Additional information: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Permeability_(earth_sciences)) range: String Example: None ph OPT Description: Ph measurement of the sample, or liquid portion of sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid range: String Example: 7.2 None porosity OPT Description: Porosity of deposited sediment is volume of voids divided by the total volume of sample range: String Example: None potassium OPT Description: Concentration of potassium in the sample range: String Example: 463 milligram per liter None pour_point OPT Description: Temperature at which a liquid becomes semi solid and loses its flow characteristics. In crude oil a high¬†pour point¬†is generally associated with a high paraffin content, typically found in crude deriving from a larger proportion of plant material. (soure: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/pour_point) range: String Example: None pressure OPT Description: Pressure to which the sample is subject to, in atmospheres range: String Example: 50 atmosphere None reservoir OPT Description: Name of the reservoir (e.g. Carapebus) range: String Example: None resins_pc OPT Description: Saturate, Aromatic, Resin and Asphaltene¬†(SARA) is an analysis method that divides¬†crude oil¬†components according to their polarizability and polarity. There are three main methods to obtain SARA results. The most popular one is known as the Iatroscan TLC-FID and is referred to as IP-143 (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturate,_aromatic,_resin_and_asphaltene) range: String Example: None samp_md OPT Description: In non deviated well, measured depth is equal to the true vertical depth, TVD (TVD=TVDSS plus the reference or datum it refers to). In deviated wells, the MD is the length of trajectory of the borehole measured from the same reference or datum. Common datums used are ground level (GL), drilling rig floor (DF), rotary table (RT), kelly bushing (KB) and mean sea level (MSL). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field range: String Example: 1534 meter;MSL None samp_salinity OPT Description: Salinity is the total concentration of all dissolved salts in a liquid or solid (in the form of an extract obtained by centrifugation) sample. While salinity can be measured by a complete chemical analysis, this method is difficult and time consuming. More often, it is instead derived from the conductivity measurement. This is known as practical salinity. These derivations compare the specific conductance of the sample to a salinity standard such as seawater range: String Example: 1 milligram per liter None samp_store_dur OPT Description: Duration for which the sample was stored range: String Example: P1Y6M None samp_store_loc OPT Description: Location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room range: String Example: Freezer no:5 None samp_store_temp OPT Description: Temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80 degree Celsius range: String Example: -80 degree Celsius None samp_subtype OPT Description: Name of sample sub-type. For example if "sample type" is "Produced Water" then subtype could be "Oil Phase" or "Water Phase". If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field range: String Example: biofilm None samp_transport_cond OPT Description: Sample transport duration (in days or hrs) and temperature the sample was exposed to (e.g. 5.5 days; 20 ¬∞C) range: String Example: 5 days;-20 degree Celsius None samp_tvdss OPT Description: Depth of the sample i.e. The vertical distance between the sea level and the sampled position in the subsurface. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples e.g. 1325.75-1362.25 m range: String Example: None samp_type OPT Description: Type of material (i.e. sample) collected. Includes types like core, rock trimmings, drill cuttings, piping section, coupon, pigging debris, solid deposit, produced fluid, produced water, injected water, swabs, etc. If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field range: String Example: solid deposit None samp_vol_we_dna_ext OPT Description: Volume (ml), weight (g) of processed sample, or surface area swabbed from sample for DNA extraction range: String Example: 1500 milliliter None samp_well_name OPT Description: Name of the well (e.g. BXA1123) where sample was taken range: String Example: None saturates_pc OPT Description: Saturate, Aromatic, Resin and Asphaltene¬†(SARA) is an analysis method that divides¬†crude oil¬†components according to their polarizability and polarity. There are three main methods to obtain SARA results. The most popular one is known as the Iatroscan TLC-FID and is referred to as IP-143 (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturate,_aromatic,_resin_and_asphaltene) range: String Example: None sodium OPT Description: Sodium concentration in the sample range: String Example: 10.5 milligram per liter None sr_dep_env OPT Description: Source rock depositional environment (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Source_rock). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field range: String Example: Marine None sr_geol_age OPT Description: Geological age of source rock (Additional info: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Period_(geology)). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field range: String Example: Silurian None sr_kerog_type OPT Description: Origin of kerogen. Type I: Algal (aquatic), Type II: planktonic and soft plant material (aquatic or terrestrial), Type III: terrestrial woody/ fibrous plant material (terrestrial), Type IV: oxidized recycled woody debris (terrestrial) (additional information: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kerogen). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field range: String Example: Type IV None sr_lithology OPT Description: Lithology of source rock (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Source_rock). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field range: String Example: Coal None sulfate OPT Description: Concentration of sulfate in the sample range: String Example: 5 micromole per liter None sulfate_fw OPT Description: Original sulfate concentration in the hydrocarbon resource range: String Example: None sulfide OPT Description: Concentration of sulfide in the sample range: String Example: 2 micromole per liter None suspend_solids OPT Description: Concentration of substances including a wide variety of material, such as silt, decaying plant and animal matter; can include multiple substances range: String Example: None tan OPT Description: Total Acid Number¬†(TAN) is a measurement of acidity that is determined by the amount of¬†potassium hydroxide¬†in milligrams that is needed to neutralize the acids in one gram of oil.¬†It is an important quality measurement of¬†crude oil. (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Total_acid_number) range: String Example: None temp OPT Description: Temperature of the sample at the time of sampling range: String Example: 25 degree Celsius None toluene OPT Description: Concentration of toluene in the sample range: String Example: None tot_iron OPT Description: Concentration of total iron in the sample range: String Example: None tot_nitro OPT Description: Total nitrogen concentration of water samples, calculated by: total nitrogen = total dissolved nitrogen + particulate nitrogen. Can also be measured without filtering, reported as nitrogen range: String Example: 50 micromole per liter None tot_phosp OPT Description: Total phosphorus concentration in the sample, calculated by: total phosphorus = total dissolved phosphorus + particulate phosphorus range: String Example: 0.03 milligram per liter None tot_sulfur OPT Description: Concentration of total sulfur in the sample range: String Example: None tvdss_of_hcr_pressure OPT Description: True vertical depth subsea (TVDSS) of the hydrocarbon resource where the original pressure was measured (e.g. 1578 m ) range: String Example: None tvdss_of_hcr_temp OPT Description: True vertical depth subsea (TVDSS) of the hydrocarbon resource where the original temperature was measured (e.g. 1345 m) range: String Example: None vfa OPT Description: Concentration of Volatile Fatty Acids in the sample range: String Example: None vfa_fw OPT Description: Original volatile fatty acid concentration in the hydrocarbon resource range: String Example: None viscosity OPT Description: A measure of oil's resistance¬†to gradual deformation by¬†shear stress¬†or¬†tensile stress (e.g. 3.5 cp; 100 ¬∞C) range: String Example: None win OPT Description: A unique identifier of a well or wellbore. This is part of the Global Framework for Well Identification initiative which is compiled by the Professional Petroleum Data Management Association (PPDM) in an effort to improve well identification systems. docs.text: Type: hydrocarbon resources-fluids_swabs hydrocarbon resources-fluids/swabs URI: mixs.vocab:HydrocarbonResources-fluidsSwabs Attributes Own add_recov_method OPT Description: Additional (i.e. Secondary, tertiary, etc.) recovery methods deployed for increase of hydrocarbon recovery from resource and start date for each one of them. If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field range: String Example: Polymer Addition;2018-06-21T14:30Z None additional_info OPT Description: Information that doesn't fit anywhere else. Can also be used to propose new entries for fields with controlled vocabulary range: String Example: None alkalinity OPT Description: Alkalinity, the ability of a solution to neutralize acids to the equivalence point of carbonate or bicarbonate range: String Example: 50 milligram per liter None alkalinity_method OPT Description: Method used for alkalinity measurement range: String Example: titration None ammonium OPT Description: Concentration of ammonium in the sample range: String Example: 1.5 milligram per liter None api OPT Description: API gravity is a measure of how heavy or light a petroleum liquid is compared to water (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/API_gravity) (e.g. 31.1¬∞ API) range: String Example: None aromatics_pc OPT Description: Saturate, Aromatic, Resin and Asphaltene¬†(SARA) is an analysis method that divides¬†crude oil¬†components according to their polarizability and polarity. There are three main methods to obtain SARA results. The most popular one is known as the Iatroscan TLC-FID and is referred to as IP-143 (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturate,_aromatic,_resin_and_asphaltene) range: String Example: None asphaltenes_pc OPT Description: Saturate, Aromatic, Resin and Asphaltene¬†(SARA) is an analysis method that divides¬†crude oil¬†components according to their polarizability and polarity. There are three main methods to obtain SARA results. The most popular one is known as the Iatroscan TLC-FID and is referred to as IP-143 (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturate,_aromatic,_resin_and_asphaltene) range: String Example: None basin OPT Description: Name of the basin (e.g. Campos) range: String Example: None benzene OPT Description: Concentration of benzene in the sample range: String Example: None biocide OPT Description: List of biocides (commercial name of product and supplier) and date of administration range: String Example: ALPHA 1427;Baker Hughes;2008-01-23 None biocide_admin_method OPT Description: Method of biocide administration (dose, frequency, duration, time elapsed between last biociding and sampling) (e.g. 150 mg/l; weekly; 4 hr; 3 days) range: String Example: None calcium OPT Description: Concentration of calcium in the sample range: String Example: 0.2 micromole per liter None chem_treatment OPT Description: List of chemical compounds administered upstream the sampling location where sampling occurred (e.g. Glycols, H2S scavenger, corrosion and scale inhibitors, demulsifiers, and other production chemicals etc.). The commercial name of the product and name of the supplier should be provided. The date of administration should also be included range: String Example: ACCENT 1125;DOW;2010-11-17 None chem_treatment_method OPT Description: Method of chemical administration(dose, frequency, duration, time elapsed between administration and sampling) (e.g. 50 mg/l; twice a week; 1 hr; 0 days) range: String Example: None chloride OPT Description: Concentration of chloride in the sample range: String Example: 5000 milligram per liter None density OPT Description: Density of the sample, which is its mass per unit volume (aka volumetric mass density) range: String Example: 1000 kilogram per cubic meter None depos_env OPT Description: Main depositional environment (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Depositional_environment). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field range: String Example: Continental - Alluvial None diss_carb_dioxide OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved carbon dioxide in the sample or liquid portion of the sample range: String Example: 5 milligram per liter None diss_inorg_carb OPT Description: Dissolved inorganic carbon concentration in the sample, typically measured after filtering the sample using a 0.45 micrometer filter range: String Example: 2059 micromole per kilogram None diss_inorg_phosp OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved inorganic phosphorus in the sample range: String Example: 56.5 micromole per liter None diss_iron OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved iron in the sample range: String Example: None diss_org_carb OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved organic carbon in the sample, liquid portion of the sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid range: String Example: 197 micromole per liter None diss_oxygen_fluid OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved oxygen in the oil field produced fluids as it contributes to oxgen-corrosion and microbial activity (e.g. Mic). range: String Example: None ethylbenzene OPT Description: Concentration of ethylbenzene in the sample range: String Example: None field OPT Description: Name of the hydrocarbon field (e.g. Albacora) range: String Example: None hc_produced OPT Description: Main hydrocarbon type produced from resource (i.e. Oil, gas, condensate, etc). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field range: String Example: Gas None hcr OPT Description: Main Hydrocarbon Resource type. The term "Hydrocarbon Resource" HCR defined as a natural environmental feature containing large amounts of hydrocarbons at high concentrations potentially suitable for commercial exploitation. This term should not be confused with the Hydrocarbon Occurrence term which also includes hydrocarbon-rich environments with currently limited commercial interest such as seeps, outcrops, gas hydrates etc. If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field range: String Example: Oil Sand None hcr_fw_salinity OPT Description: Original formation water salinity (prior to secondary recovery e.g. Waterflooding) expressed as TDS range: String Example: None hcr_geol_age OPT Description: Geological age of hydrocarbon resource (Additional info: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Period_(geology)). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field range: String Example: Silurian None hcr_pressure OPT Description: Original pressure of the hydrocarbon resource range: String Example: None hcr_temp OPT Description: Original temperature of the hydrocarbon resource range: String Example: 150-295 degree Celsius None iw_bt_date_well OPT Description: Injection water breakthrough date per well following a secondary and/or tertiary recovery range: String Example: 2018-05-11 None iwf OPT Description: Proportion of the produced fluids derived from injected water at the time of sampling. (e.g. 87%) range: String Example: None lithology OPT Description: Hydrocarbon resource main lithology (Additional information: http://petrowiki.org/Lithology_and_rock_type_determination). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field range: String Example: Volcanic None magnesium OPT Description: Concentration of magnesium in the sample range: String Example: 52.8 micromole per kilogram None misc_param OPT Description: Any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here range: String Example: Bicarbonate ion concentration;2075 micromole per kilogram None nitrate OPT Description: Concentration of nitrate in the sample range: String Example: 65 micromole per liter None nitrite OPT Description: Concentration of nitrite in the sample range: String Example: 0.5 micromole per liter None organism_count OPT Description: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) Should also be provided. (example: total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qpcr) range: String Example: total prokaryotes;3.5e7 cells per milliliter;qPCR None organism_count_qpcr_info OPT Description: If qpcr was used for the cell count, the target gene name, the primer sequence and the cycling conditions should also be provided. (Example: 16S rrna; FWD:ACGTAGCTATGACGT REV:GTGCTAGTCGAGTAC; initial denaturation:90C_5min; denaturation:90C_2min; annealing:52C_30 sec; elongation:72C_30 sec; 90 C for 1 min; final elongation:72C_5min; 30 cycles) range: String Example: None oxy_stat_samp OPT Description: Oxygenation status of sample range: String Example: aerobic None ph OPT Description: Ph measurement of the sample, or liquid portion of sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid range: String Example: 7.2 None potassium OPT Description: Concentration of potassium in the sample range: String Example: 463 milligram per liter None pour_point OPT Description: Temperature at which a liquid becomes semi solid and loses its flow characteristics. In crude oil a high¬†pour point¬†is generally associated with a high paraffin content, typically found in crude deriving from a larger proportion of plant material. (soure: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/pour_point) range: String Example: None pressure OPT Description: Pressure to which the sample is subject to, in atmospheres range: String Example: 50 atmosphere None prod_rate OPT Description: Oil and/or gas production rates per well (e.g. 524 m3 / day) range: String Example: None prod_start_date OPT Description: Date of field's first production range: String Example: 2018-05-11 None reservoir OPT Description: Name of the reservoir (e.g. Carapebus) range: String Example: None resins_pc OPT Description: Saturate, Aromatic, Resin and Asphaltene¬†(SARA) is an analysis method that divides¬†crude oil¬†components according to their polarizability and polarity. There are three main methods to obtain SARA results. The most popular one is known as the Iatroscan TLC-FID and is referred to as IP-143 (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturate,_aromatic,_resin_and_asphaltene) range: String Example: None samp_collection_point OPT Description: Sampling point on the asset were sample was collected (e.g. Wellhead, storage tank, separator, etc). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field range: String Example: well None samp_loc_corr_rate OPT Description: Metal corrosion rate is the speed of metal deterioration due to environmental conditions. As environmental conditions change corrosion rates change accordingly. Therefore, long term corrosion rates are generally more informative than short term rates and for that reason they are preferred during reporting. In the case of suspected MIC, corrosion rate measurements at the time of sampling might provide insights into the involvement of certain microbial community members in MIC as well as potential microbial interplays range: String Example: None samp_preserv OPT Description: Preservative added to the sample (e.g. Rnalater, alcohol, formaldehyde, etc.). Where appropriate include volume added (e.g. Rnalater; 2 ml) range: String Example: None samp_salinity OPT Description: Salinity is the total concentration of all dissolved salts in a liquid or solid (in the form of an extract obtained by centrifugation) sample. While salinity can be measured by a complete chemical analysis, this method is difficult and time consuming. More often, it is instead derived from the conductivity measurement. This is known as practical salinity. These derivations compare the specific conductance of the sample to a salinity standard such as seawater range: String Example: 1 milligram per liter None samp_store_dur OPT Description: Duration for which the sample was stored range: String Example: P1Y6M None samp_store_loc OPT Description: Location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room range: String Example: Freezer no:5 None samp_store_temp OPT Description: Temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80 degree Celsius range: String Example: -80 degree Celsius None samp_subtype OPT Description: Name of sample sub-type. For example if "sample type" is "Produced Water" then subtype could be "Oil Phase" or "Water Phase". If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field range: String Example: biofilm None samp_transport_cond OPT Description: Sample transport duration (in days or hrs) and temperature the sample was exposed to (e.g. 5.5 days; 20 ¬∞C) range: String Example: 5 days;-20 degree Celsius None samp_type OPT Description: Type of material (i.e. sample) collected. Includes types like core, rock trimmings, drill cuttings, piping section, coupon, pigging debris, solid deposit, produced fluid, produced water, injected water, swabs, etc. If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field range: String Example: solid deposit None samp_vol_we_dna_ext OPT Description: Volume (ml), weight (g) of processed sample, or surface area swabbed from sample for DNA extraction range: String Example: 1500 milliliter None samp_well_name OPT Description: Name of the well (e.g. BXA1123) where sample was taken range: String Example: None saturates_pc OPT Description: Saturate, Aromatic, Resin and Asphaltene¬†(SARA) is an analysis method that divides¬†crude oil¬†components according to their polarizability and polarity. There are three main methods to obtain SARA results. The most popular one is known as the Iatroscan TLC-FID and is referred to as IP-143 (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturate,_aromatic,_resin_and_asphaltene) range: String Example: None sodium OPT Description: Sodium concentration in the sample range: String Example: 10.5 milligram per liter None sulfate OPT Description: Concentration of sulfate in the sample range: String Example: 5 micromole per liter None sulfate_fw OPT Description: Original sulfate concentration in the hydrocarbon resource range: String Example: None sulfide OPT Description: Concentration of sulfide in the sample range: String Example: 2 micromole per liter None suspend_solids OPT Description: Concentration of substances including a wide variety of material, such as silt, decaying plant and animal matter; can include multiple substances range: String Example: None tan OPT Description: Total Acid Number¬†(TAN) is a measurement of acidity that is determined by the amount of¬†potassium hydroxide¬†in milligrams that is needed to neutralize the acids in one gram of oil.¬†It is an important quality measurement of¬†crude oil. (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Total_acid_number) range: String Example: None temp OPT Description: Temperature of the sample at the time of sampling range: String Example: 25 degree Celsius None toluene OPT Description: Concentration of toluene in the sample range: String Example: None tot_iron OPT Description: Concentration of total iron in the sample range: String Example: None tot_nitro OPT Description: Total nitrogen concentration of water samples, calculated by: total nitrogen = total dissolved nitrogen + particulate nitrogen. Can also be measured without filtering, reported as nitrogen range: String Example: 50 micromole per liter None tot_phosp OPT Description: Total phosphorus concentration in the sample, calculated by: total phosphorus = total dissolved phosphorus + particulate phosphorus range: String Example: 0.03 milligram per liter None tot_sulfur OPT Description: Concentration of total sulfur in the sample range: String Example: None tvdss_of_hcr_pressure OPT Description: True vertical depth subsea (TVDSS) of the hydrocarbon resource where the original pressure was measured (e.g. 1578 m ) range: String Example: None tvdss_of_hcr_temp OPT Description: True vertical depth subsea (TVDSS) of the hydrocarbon resource where the original temperature was measured (e.g. 1345 m) range: String Example: None vfa OPT Description: Concentration of Volatile Fatty Acids in the sample range: String Example: None vfa_fw OPT Description: Original volatile fatty acid concentration in the hydrocarbon resource range: String Example: None viscosity OPT Description: A measure of oil's resistance¬†to gradual deformation by¬†shear stress¬†or¬†tensile stress (e.g. 3.5 cp; 100 ¬∞C) range: String Example: None water_cut OPT Description: Current amount of water (%) in a produced fluid stream; or the average of the combined streams range: String Example: None water_production_rate OPT Description: Water production rates per well (e.g. 987 m3 / day) range: String Example: None win OPT Description: A unique identifier of a well or wellbore. This is part of the Global Framework for Well Identification initiative which is compiled by the Professional Petroleum Data Management Association (PPDM) in an effort to improve well identification systems. (Supporting information: https://ppdm.org/ and http://dl.ppdm.org/dl/690) range: String Example: None xylene OPT Description: Concentration of xylene in the sample range: String Example: None

docs.text: add_recov_method OPT Description: Additional (i.e. Secondary, tertiary, etc.) recovery methods deployed for increase of hydrocarbon recovery from resource and start date for each one of them. If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field range: String Example: Polymer Addition;2018-06-21T14:30Z None additional_info OPT Description: Information that doesn't fit anywhere else. Can also be used to propose new entries for fields with controlled vocabulary range: String Example: None alkalinity OPT Description: Alkalinity, the ability of a solution to neutralize acids to the equivalence point of carbonate or bicarbonate range: String Example: 50 milligram per liter None alkalinity_method OPT Description: Method used for alkalinity measurement range: String Example: titration None ammonium OPT Description: Concentration of ammonium in the sample range: String Example: 1.5 milligram per liter None api OPT Description: API gravity is a measure of how heavy or light a petroleum liquid is compared to water (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/API_gravity) (e.g. 31.1¬∞ API) range: String Example: None aromatics_pc OPT Description: Saturate, Aromatic, Resin and Asphaltene¬†(SARA) is an analysis method that divides¬†crude oil¬†components according to their polarizability and polarity. There are three main methods to obtain SARA results. The most popular one is known as the Iatroscan TLC-FID and is referred to as IP-143 (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturate,_aromatic,_resin_and_asphaltene) range: String Example: None asphaltenes_pc OPT Description: Saturate, Aromatic, Resin and Asphaltene¬†(SARA) is an analysis method that divides¬†crude oil¬†components according to their polarizability and polarity. There are three main methods to obtain SARA results. The most popular one is known as the Iatroscan TLC-FID and is referred to as IP-143 (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturate,_aromatic,_resin_and_asphaltene) range: String Example: None basin OPT Description: Name of the basin (e.g. Campos) range: String Example: None benzene OPT Description: Concentration of benzene in the sample range: String Example: None biocide OPT Description: List of biocides (commercial name of product and supplier) and date of administration range: String Example: ALPHA 1427;Baker Hughes;2008-01-23 None biocide_admin_method OPT Description: Method of biocide administration (dose, frequency, duration, time elapsed between last biociding and sampling) (e.g. 150 mg/l; weekly; 4 hr; 3 days) range: String Example: None calcium OPT Description: Concentration of calcium in the sample range: String Example: 0.2 micromole per liter None chem_treatment OPT Description: List of chemical compounds administered upstream the sampling location where sampling occurred (e.g. Glycols, H2S scavenger, corrosion and scale inhibitors, demulsifiers, and other production chemicals etc.). The commercial name of the product and name of the supplier should be provided. The date of administration should also be included range: String Example: ACCENT 1125;DOW;2010-11-17 None chem_treatment_method OPT Description: Method of chemical administration(dose, frequency, duration, time elapsed between administration and sampling) (e.g. 50 mg/l; twice a week; 1 hr; 0 days) range: String Example: None chloride OPT Description: Concentration of chloride in the sample range: String Example: 5000 milligram per liter None density OPT Description: Density of the sample, which is its mass per unit volume (aka volumetric mass density) range: String Example: 1000 kilogram per cubic meter None depos_env OPT Description: Main depositional environment (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Depositional_environment). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field range: String Example: Continental - Alluvial None diss_carb_dioxide OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved carbon dioxide in the sample or liquid portion of the sample range: String Example: 5 milligram per liter None diss_inorg_carb OPT Description: Dissolved inorganic carbon concentration in the sample, typically measured after filtering the sample using a 0.45 micrometer filter range: String Example: 2059 micromole per kilogram None diss_inorg_phosp OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved inorganic phosphorus in the sample range: String Example: 56.5 micromole per liter None diss_iron OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved iron in the sample range: String Example: None diss_org_carb OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved organic carbon in the sample, liquid portion of the sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid range: String Example: 197 micromole per liter None diss_oxygen_fluid OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved oxygen in the oil field produced fluids as it contributes to oxgen-corrosion and microbial activity (e.g. Mic). range: String Example: None ethylbenzene OPT Description: Concentration of ethylbenzene in the sample range: String Example: None field OPT Description: Name of the hydrocarbon field (e.g. Albacora) range: String Example: None hc_produced OPT Description: Main hydrocarbon type produced from resource (i.e. Oil, gas, condensate, etc). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field range: String Example: Gas None hcr OPT Description: Main Hydrocarbon Resource type. The term "Hydrocarbon Resource" HCR defined as a natural environmental feature containing large amounts of hydrocarbons at high concentrations potentially suitable for commercial exploitation. This term should not be confused with the Hydrocarbon Occurrence term which also includes hydrocarbon-rich environments with currently limited commercial interest such as seeps, outcrops, gas hydrates etc. If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field range: String Example: Oil Sand None hcr_fw_salinity OPT Description: Original formation water salinity (prior to secondary recovery e.g. Waterflooding) expressed as TDS range: String Example: None hcr_geol_age OPT Description: Geological age of hydrocarbon resource (Additional info: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Period_(geology)). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field range: String Example: Silurian None hcr_pressure OPT Description: Original pressure of the hydrocarbon resource range: String Example: None hcr_temp OPT Description: Original temperature of the hydrocarbon resource range: String Example: 150-295 degree Celsius None iw_bt_date_well OPT Description: Injection water breakthrough date per well following a secondary and/or tertiary recovery range: String Example: 2018-05-11 None iwf OPT Description: Proportion of the produced fluids derived from injected water at the time of sampling. (e.g. 87%) range: String Example: None lithology OPT Description: Hydrocarbon resource main lithology (Additional information: http://petrowiki.org/Lithology_and_rock_type_determination). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field range: String Example: Volcanic None magnesium OPT Description: Concentration of magnesium in the sample range: String Example: 52.8 micromole per kilogram None misc_param OPT Description: Any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here range: String Example: Bicarbonate ion concentration;2075 micromole per kilogram None nitrate OPT Description: Concentration of nitrate in the sample range: String Example: 65 micromole per liter None nitrite OPT Description: Concentration of nitrite in the sample range: String Example: 0.5 micromole per liter None organism_count OPT Description: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) Should also be provided. (example: total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qpcr) range: String Example: total prokaryotes;3.5e7 cells per milliliter;qPCR None organism_count_qpcr_info OPT Description: If qpcr was used for the cell count, the target gene name, the primer sequence and the cycling conditions should also be provided. (Example: 16S rrna; FWD:ACGTAGCTATGACGT REV:GTGCTAGTCGAGTAC; initial denaturation:90C_5min; denaturation:90C_2min; annealing:52C_30 sec; elongation:72C_30 sec; 90 C for 1 min; final elongation:72C_5min; 30 cycles) range: String Example: None oxy_stat_samp OPT Description: Oxygenation status of sample range: String Example: aerobic None ph OPT Description: Ph measurement of the sample, or liquid portion of sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid range: String Example: 7.2 None potassium OPT Description: Concentration of potassium in the sample range: String Example: 463 milligram per liter None pour_point OPT Description: Temperature at which a liquid becomes semi solid and loses its flow characteristics. In crude oil a high¬†pour point¬†is generally associated with a high paraffin content, typically found in crude deriving from a larger proportion of plant material. (soure: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/pour_point) range: String Example: None pressure OPT Description: Pressure to which the sample is subject to, in atmospheres range: String Example: 50 atmosphere None prod_rate OPT Description: Oil and/or gas production rates per well (e.g. 524 m3 / day) range: String Example: None prod_start_date OPT Description: Date of field's first production range: String Example: 2018-05-11 None reservoir OPT Description: Name of the reservoir (e.g. Carapebus) range: String Example: None resins_pc OPT Description: Saturate, Aromatic, Resin and Asphaltene¬†(SARA) is an analysis method that divides¬†crude oil¬†components according to their polarizability and polarity. There are three main methods to obtain SARA results. The most popular one is known as the Iatroscan TLC-FID and is referred to as IP-143 (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturate,_aromatic,_resin_and_asphaltene) range: String Example: None samp_collection_point OPT Description: Sampling point on the asset were sample was collected (e.g. Wellhead, storage tank, separator, etc). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field range: String Example: well None samp_loc_corr_rate OPT Description: Metal corrosion rate is the speed of metal deterioration due to environmental conditions. As environmental conditions change corrosion rates change accordingly. Therefore, long term corrosion rates are generally more informative than short term rates and for that reason they are preferred during reporting. In the case of suspected MIC, corrosion rate measurements at the time of sampling might provide insights into the involvement of certain microbial community members in MIC as well as potential microbial interplays range: String Example: None samp_preserv OPT Description: Preservative added to the sample (e.g. Rnalater, alcohol, formaldehyde, etc.). Where appropriate include volume added (e.g. Rnalater; 2 ml) range: String Example: None samp_salinity OPT Description: Salinity is the total concentration of all dissolved salts in a liquid or solid (in the form of an extract obtained by centrifugation) sample. While salinity can be measured by a complete chemical analysis, this method is difficult and time consuming. More often, it is instead derived from the conductivity measurement. This is known as practical salinity. These derivations compare the specific conductance of the sample to a salinity standard such as seawater range: String Example: 1 milligram per liter None samp_store_dur OPT Description: Duration for which the sample was stored range: String Example: P1Y6M None samp_store_loc OPT Description: Location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room range: String Example: Freezer no:5 None samp_store_temp OPT Description: Temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80 degree Celsius range: String Example: -80 degree Celsius None samp_subtype OPT Description: Name of sample sub-type. For example if "sample type" is "Produced Water" then subtype could be "Oil Phase" or "Water Phase". If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field range: String Example: biofilm None samp_transport_cond OPT Description: Sample transport duration (in days or hrs) and temperature the sample was exposed to (e.g. 5.5 days; 20 ¬∞C) range: String Example: 5 days;-20 degree Celsius None samp_type OPT Description: Type of material (i.e. sample) collected. Includes types like core, rock trimmings, drill cuttings, piping section, coupon, pigging debris, solid deposit, produced fluid, produced water, injected water, swabs, etc. If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field range: String Example: solid deposit None samp_vol_we_dna_ext OPT Description: Volume (ml), weight (g) of processed sample, or surface area swabbed from sample for DNA extraction range: String Example: 1500 milliliter None samp_well_name OPT Description: Name of the well (e.g. BXA1123) where sample was taken range: String Example: None saturates_pc OPT Description: Saturate, Aromatic, Resin and Asphaltene¬†(SARA) is an analysis method that divides¬†crude oil¬†components according to their polarizability and polarity. There are three main methods to obtain SARA results. The most popular one is known as the Iatroscan TLC-FID and is referred to as IP-143 (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturate,_aromatic,_resin_and_asphaltene) range: String Example: None sodium OPT Description: Sodium concentration in the sample range: String Example: 10.5 milligram per liter None sulfate OPT Description: Concentration of sulfate in the sample range: String Example: 5 micromole per liter None sulfate_fw OPT Description: Original sulfate concentration in the hydrocarbon resource range: String Example: None sulfide OPT Description: Concentration of sulfide in the sample range: String Example: 2 micromole per liter None suspend_solids OPT Description: Concentration of substances including a wide variety of material, such as silt, decaying plant and animal matter; can include multiple substances range: String Example: None tan OPT Description: Total Acid Number¬†(TAN) is a measurement of acidity that is determined by the amount of¬†potassium hydroxide¬†in milligrams that is needed to neutralize the acids in one gram of oil.¬†It is an important quality measurement of¬†crude oil. (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Total_acid_number) range: String Example: None temp OPT Description: Temperature of the sample at the time of sampling range: String Example: 25 degree Celsius None toluene OPT Description: Concentration of toluene in the sample range: String Example: None tot_iron OPT Description: Concentration of total iron in the sample range: String Example: None tot_nitro OPT Description: Total nitrogen concentration of water samples, calculated by: total nitrogen = total dissolved nitrogen + particulate nitrogen. Can also be measured without filtering, reported as nitrogen range: String Example: 50 micromole per liter None tot_phosp OPT Description: Total phosphorus concentration in the sample, calculated by: total phosphorus = total dissolved phosphorus + particulate phosphorus range: String Example: 0.03 milligram per liter None tot_sulfur OPT Description: Concentration of total sulfur in the sample range: String Example: None tvdss_of_hcr_pressure OPT Description: True vertical depth subsea (TVDSS) of the hydrocarbon resource where the original pressure was measured (e.g. 1578 m ) range: String Example: None tvdss_of_hcr_temp OPT Description: True vertical depth subsea (TVDSS) of the hydrocarbon resource where the original temperature was measured (e.g. 1345 m) range: String Example: None vfa OPT Description: Concentration of Volatile Fatty Acids in the sample range: String Example: None vfa_fw OPT Description: Original volatile fatty acid concentration in the hydrocarbon resource range: String Example: None viscosity OPT Description: A measure of oil's resistance¬†to gradual deformation by¬†shear stress¬†or¬†tensile stress (e.g. 3.5 cp; 100 ¬∞C) range: String Example: None water_cut OPT Description: Current amount of water (%) in a produced fluid stream; or the average of the combined streams range: String Example: None water_production_rate OPT Description: Water production rates per well (e.g. 987 m3 / day) range: String Example: None win OPT Description: A unique identifier of a well or wellbore. This is part of the Global Framework for Well Identification initiative which is compiled by the Professional Petroleum Data Management Association (PPDM) in an effort to improve well identification systems. (Supporting information: https://ppdm.org/ and http://dl.ppdm.org/dl/690) range: String Example: None xylene OPT Description: Concentration of xylene in the sample range: String Example: None

docs.text: Type: microbial mat_biofilm microbial mat/biofilm URI: mixs.vocab:MicrobialMatBiofilm Attributes Own alkalinity OPT Description: Alkalinity, the ability of a solution to neutralize acids to the equivalence point of carbonate or bicarbonate range: String Example: 50 milligram per liter None alkyl_diethers OPT Description: Concentration of alkyl diethers range: String Example: 0.005 mole per liter None aminopept_act OPT Description: Measurement of aminopeptidase activity range: String Example: 0.269 mole per liter per hour None ammonium OPT Description: Concentration of ammonium in the sample range: String Example: 1.5 milligram per liter None bacteria_carb_prod OPT Description: Measurement of bacterial carbon production range: String Example: 2.53 microgram per liter per hour None biomass OPT Description: Amount of biomass; should include the name for the part of biomass measured, e.g. Microbial, total. Can include multiple measurements range: String Example: total;20 gram None bishomohopanol OPT Description: Concentration of bishomohopanol range: String Example: 14 microgram per liter None bromide OPT Description: Concentration of bromide range: String Example: 0.05 parts per million None calcium OPT Description: Concentration of calcium in the sample range: String Example: 0.2 micromole per liter None carb_nitro_ratio OPT Description: Ratio of amount or concentrations of carbon to nitrogen range: String Example: 0.417361111 None chem_administration OPT Description: List of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. Antibiotics, n fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For chemical entities of biological interest ontology (chebi) (v 163), http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/chebi range: String Example: agar [CHEBI:2509];2018-05-11T20:00Z None chloride OPT Description: Concentration of chloride in the sample range: String Example: 5000 milligram per liter None chlorophyll OPT Description: Concentration of chlorophyll range: String Example: 5 milligram per cubic meter None diether_lipids OPT Description: Concentration of diether lipids; can include multiple types of diether lipids range: String Example: 0.2 nanogram per liter None diss_carb_dioxide OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved carbon dioxide in the sample or liquid portion of the sample range: String Example: 5 milligram per liter None diss_hydrogen OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved hydrogen range: String Example: 0.3 micromole per liter None diss_inorg_carb OPT Description: Dissolved inorganic carbon concentration in the sample, typically measured after filtering the sample using a 0.45 micrometer filter range: String Example: 2059 micromole per kilogram None diss_org_carb OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved organic carbon in the sample, liquid portion of the sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid range: String Example: 197 micromole per liter None diss_org_nitro OPT Description: Dissolved organic nitrogen concentration measured as; total dissolved nitrogen - NH4 - NO3 - NO2 range: String Example: 0.05 micromole per liter None diss_oxygen OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved oxygen range: String Example: 175 micromole per kilogram None glucosidase_act OPT Description: Measurement of glucosidase activity range: String Example: 5 mol per liter per hour None magnesium OPT Description: Concentration of magnesium in the sample range: String Example: 52.8 micromole per kilogram None mean_frict_vel OPT Description: Measurement of mean friction velocity range: String Example: 0.5 meter per second None mean_peak_frict_vel OPT Description: Measurement of mean peak friction velocity range: String Example: 1 meter per second None methane OPT Description: Methane (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling range: String Example: 1800 parts per billion None misc_param OPT Description: Any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here range: String Example: Bicarbonate ion concentration;2075 micromole per kilogram None n_alkanes OPT Description: Concentration of n-alkanes; can include multiple n-alkanes range: String Example: n-hexadecane;100 milligram per liter None nitrate OPT Description: Concentration of nitrate in the sample range: String Example: 65 micromole per liter None nitrite OPT Description: Concentration of nitrite in the sample range: String Example: 0.5 micromole per liter None nitro OPT Description: Concentration of nitrogen (total) range: String Example: 4.2 micromole per liter None org_carb OPT Description: Concentration of organic carbon range: String Example: 1.5 microgram per liter None org_matter OPT Description: Concentration of organic matter range: String Example: 1.75 milligram per cubic meter None org_nitro OPT Description: Concentration of organic nitrogen range: String Example: 4 micromole per liter None organism_count OPT Description: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) Should also be provided. (example: total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qpcr) range: String Example: total prokaryotes;3.5e7 cells per milliliter;qPCR None oxy_stat_samp OPT Description: Oxygenation status of sample range: String Example: aerobic None part_org_carb OPT Description: Concentration of particulate organic carbon range: String Example: 1.92 micromole per liter None perturbation OPT Description: Type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with perturbation regimen including how many times the perturbation was repeated, how long each perturbation lasted, and the start and end time of the entire perturbation period; can include multiple perturbation types range: String Example: antibiotic addition;R2/2018-05-11T14:30Z/2018-05-11T19:30Z/P1H30M None petroleum_hydrocarb OPT Description: Concentration of petroleum hydrocarbon range: String Example: 0.05 micromole per liter None ph OPT Description: Ph measurement of the sample, or liquid portion of sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid range: String Example: 7.2 None phaeopigments OPT Description: Concentration of phaeopigments; can include multiple phaeopigments range: String Example: 2.5 milligram per cubic meter None phosphate OPT Description: Concentration of phosphate range: String Example: 0.7 micromole per liter None phosplipid_fatt_acid OPT Description: Concentration of phospholipid fatty acids; can include multiple values range: String Example: 2.98 milligram per liter None potassium OPT Description: Concentration of potassium in the sample range: String Example: 463 milligram per liter None pressure OPT Description: Pressure to which the sample is subject to, in atmospheres range: String Example: 50 atmosphere None redox_potential OPT Description: Redox potential, measured relative to a hydrogen cell, indicating oxidation or reduction potential range: String Example: 300 millivolt None salinity OPT Description: Salinity is the total concentration of all dissolved salts in a water sample. While salinity can be measured by a complete chemical analysis, this method is difficult and time consuming. More often, it is instead derived from the conductivity measurement. This is known as practical salinity. These derivations compare the specific conductance of the sample to a salinity standard such as seawater range: String Example: 25 practical salinity unit None samp_store_dur OPT Description: Duration for which the sample was stored range: String Example: P1Y6M None samp_store_loc OPT Description: Location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room range: String Example: Freezer no:5 None samp_store_temp OPT Description: Temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80 degree Celsius range: String Example: -80 degree Celsius None samp_vol_we_dna_ext OPT Description: Volume (ml), weight (g) of processed sample, or surface area swabbed from sample for DNA extraction range: String Example: 1500 milliliter None silicate OPT Description: Concentration of silicate range: String Example: 0.05 micromole per liter None sodium OPT Description: Sodium concentration in the sample range: String Example: 10.5 milligram per liter None sulfate OPT Description: Concentration of sulfate in the sample range: String Example: 5 micromole per liter None sulfide OPT Description: Concentration of sulfide in the sample range: String Example: 2 micromole per liter None temp OPT Description: Temperature of the sample at the time of sampling range: String Example: 25 degree Celsius None tot_carb OPT Description: Total carbon content range: String Example: None tot_nitro_content OPT Description: Total nitrogen content of the sample range: String Example: None tot_org_carb OPT Description: Definition for soil: total organic carbon content of the soil, definition otherwise: total organic carbon content range: String Example: None turbidity OPT Description: Measure of the amount of cloudiness or haziness in water caused by individual particles range: String Example: 0.3 nephelometric turbidity units None water_content OPT Description: Water content measurement range: String Example: None

can include multiple types of diether lipids range: String Example: 0.2 nanogram per liter None diss_carb_dioxide OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved carbon dioxide in the sample or liquid portion of the sample range: String Example: 5 milligram per liter None diss_hydrogen OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved hydrogen range: String Example: 0.3 micromole per liter None diss_inorg_carb OPT Description: Dissolved inorganic carbon concentration in the sample, typically measured after filtering the sample using a 0.45 micrometer filter range: String Example: 2059 micromole per kilogram None diss_org_carb OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved organic carbon in the sample, liquid portion of the sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid range: String Example: 197 micromole per liter None diss_org_nitro OPT Description: Dissolved organic nitrogen concentration measured as; total dissolved nitrogen - NH4 - NO3 - NO2 range: String Example: 0.05 micromole per liter None diss_oxygen OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved oxygen range: String Example: 175 micromole per kilogram None glucosidase_act OPT Description: Measurement of glucosidase activity range: String Example: 5 mol per liter per hour None magnesium OPT Description: Concentration of magnesium in the sample range: String Example: 52.8 micromole per kilogram None mean_frict_vel OPT Description: Measurement of mean friction velocity range: String Example: 0.5 meter per second None mean_peak_frict_vel OPT Description: Measurement of mean peak friction velocity range: String Example: 1 meter per second None methane OPT Description: Methane (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling range: String Example: 1800 parts per billion None misc_param OPT Description: Any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here range: String Example: Bicarbonate ion concentration;2075 micromole per kilogram None n_alkanes OPT Description: Concentration of n-alkanes; can include multiple n-alkanes range: String Example: n-hexadecane;100 milligram per liter None nitrate OPT Description: Concentration of nitrate in the sample range: String Example: 65 micromole per liter None nitrite OPT Description: Concentration of nitrite in the sample range: String Example: 0.5 micromole per liter None nitro OPT Description: Concentration of nitrogen (total) range: String Example: 4.2 micromole per liter None org_carb OPT Description: Concentration of organic carbon range: String Example: 1.5 microgram per liter None org_matter OPT Description: Concentration of organic matter range: String Example: 1.75 milligram per cubic meter None org_nitro OPT Description: Concentration of organic nitrogen range: String Example: 4 micromole per liter None organism_count OPT Description: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) Should also be provided. (example: total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qpcr) range: String Example: total prokaryotes;3.5e7 cells per milliliter;qPCR None oxy_stat_samp OPT Description: Oxygenation status of sample range: String Example: aerobic None part_org_carb OPT Description: Concentration of particulate organic carbon range: String Example: 1.92 micromole per liter None perturbation OPT Description: Type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with perturbation regimen including how many times the perturbation was repeated, how long each perturbation lasted, and the start and end time of the entire perturbation period; can include multiple perturbation types range: String Example: antibiotic addition;R2/2018-05-11T14:30Z/2018-05-11T19:30Z/P1H30M None petroleum_hydrocarb OPT Description: Concentration of petroleum hydrocarbon range: String Example: 0.05 micromole per liter None ph OPT Description: Ph measurement of the sample, or liquid portion of sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid range: String Example: 7.2 None phaeopigments OPT Description: Concentration of phaeopigments; can include multiple phaeopigments range: String Example: 2.5 milligram per cubic meter None phosphate OPT Description: Concentration of phosphate range: String Example: 0.7 micromole per liter None phosplipid_fatt_acid OPT Description: Concentration of phospholipid fatty acids; can include multiple values range: String Example: 2.98 milligram per liter None potassium OPT Description: Concentration of potassium in the sample range: String Example: 463 milligram per liter None pressure OPT Description: Pressure to which the sample is subject to, in atmospheres range: String Example: 50 atmosphere None redox_potential OPT Description: Redox potential, measured relative to a hydrogen cell, indicating oxidation or reduction potential range: String Example: 300 millivolt None salinity OPT Description: Salinity is the total concentration of all dissolved salts in a water sample. While salinity can be measured by a complete chemical analysis, this method is difficult and time consuming. More often, it is instead derived from the conductivity measurement. This is known as practical salinity. These derivations compare the specific conductance of the sample to a salinity standard such as seawater range: String Example: 25 practical salinity unit None samp_store_dur OPT Description: Duration for which the sample was stored range: String Example: P1Y6M None samp_store_loc OPT Description: Location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room range: String Example: Freezer no:5 None samp_store_temp OPT Description: Temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80 degree Celsius range: String Example: -80 degree Celsius None samp_vol_we_dna_ext OPT Description: Volume (ml), weight (g) of processed sample, or surface area swabbed from sample for DNA extraction range: String Example: 1500 milliliter None silicate OPT Description: Concentration of silicate range: String Example: 0.05 micromole per liter None sodium OPT Description: Sodium concentration in the sample range: String Example: 10.5 milligram per liter None sulfate OPT Description: Concentration of sulfate in the sample range: String Example: 5 micromole per liter None sulfide OPT Description: Concentration of sulfide in the sample range: String Example: 2 micromole per liter None temp OPT Description: Temperature of the sample at the time of sampling range: String Example: 25 degree Celsius None tot_carb OPT Description: Total carbon content range: String Example: None tot_nitro_content OPT Description: Total nitrogen content of the sample range: String Example: None tot_org_carb OPT Description: Definition for soil: total organic carbon content of the soil, definition otherwise: total organic carbon content range: String Example: None turbidity OPT Description: Measure of the amount of cloudiness or haziness in water caused by individual particles range: String Example: 0.3 nephelometric turbidity units None water_content OPT Description: Water content measurement range: String Example: None
