docs.text: Type: plant-associated plant-associated URI: mixs.vocab:Plant-associated Attributes Own air_temp_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment involving an exposure to varying temperatures; should include the temperature, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include different temperature regimens range: String Example: 25 degree Celsius;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None ances_data OPT Description: Information about either pedigree or other ancestral information description (e.g. parental variety in case of mutant or selection), e.g. A/3*B (meaning [(A x B) x B] x B) range: String Example: A/3*B None antibiotic_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment involving antibiotic administration; should include the name of antibiotic, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple antibiotic regimens range: String Example: penicillin;5 milligram;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None biol_stat OPT Description: The level of genome modification range: String Example: natural None biotic_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment(s) involving use of biotic factors, such as bacteria, viruses or fungi. range: String Example: sample inoculated with Rhizobium spp. Culture None chem_administration OPT Description: List of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. Antibiotics, n fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For chemical entities of biological interest ontology (chebi) (v 163), http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/chebi range: String Example: agar [CHEBI:2509];2018-05-11T20:00Z None chem_mutagen OPT Description: Treatment involving use of mutagens; should include the name of mutagen, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple mutagen regimens range: String Example: nitrous acid;0.5 milligram per liter;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None climate_environment OPT Description: Treatment involving an exposure to a particular climate; treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple climates range: String Example: tropical climate;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None cult_root_med OPT Description: Name or reference for the hydroponic or in vitro culture rooting medium; can be the name of a commonly used medium or reference to a specific medium, e.g. Murashige and Skoog medium. If the medium has not been formally published, use the rooting medium descriptors. range: String Example: http://himedialabs.com/TD/PT158.pdf None fertilizer_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment involving the use of fertilizers; should include the name of fertilizer, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple fertilizer regimens range: String Example: urea;0.6 milligram per liter;R2/2018-05-11:T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None fungicide_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment involving use of fungicides; should include the name of fungicide, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple fungicide regimens range: String Example: bifonazole;1 mole per liter;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None gaseous_environment OPT Description: Use of conditions with differing gaseous environments; should include the name of gaseous compound, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple gaseous environment regimens range: String Example: nitric oxide;0.5 micromole per liter;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None genetic_mod OPT Description: Genetic modifications of the genome of an organism, which may occur naturally by spontaneous mutation, or be introduced by some experimental means, e.g. specification of a transgene or the gene knocked-out or details of transient transfection range: String Example: aox1A transgenic None gravity OPT Description: Information about treatment involving use of gravity factor to study various types of responses in presence, absence or modified levels of gravity; treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple treatments range: String Example: 12 g;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None growth_facil OPT Description: Type of facility where the sampled plant was grown; controlled vocabulary: growth chamber, open top chamber, glasshouse, experimental garden, field. Alternatively use Crop Ontology (CO) terms, see http://www.cropontology.org/ontology/CO_715/Crop%20Research range: String Example: Growth chamber [CO_715:0000189] None growth_habit OPT Description: Characteristic shape, appearance or growth form of a plant species range: String Example: spreading None growth_hormone_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include the name of growth hormone, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple growth hormone regimens range: String Example: abscisic acid;0.5 milligram per liter;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None herbicide_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment involving use of herbicides; information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include the name of herbicide, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens range: String Example: atrazine;10 milligram per liter;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None host_age OPT Description: Age of host at the time of sampling; relevant scale depends on species and study, e.g. Could be seconds for amoebae or centuries for trees range: String Example: 10 days None host_common_name OPT Description: Common name of the host, e.g. Human range: String Example: mussel None host_disease_stat OPT Description: List of diseases with which the host has been diagnosed; can include multiple diagnoses. The value of the field depends on host; for humans the terms should be chosen from the DO (Human Disease Ontology) at https://www.disease-ontology.org, non-human host diseases are free text range: String Example: rabies [DOID:11260] None host_dry_mass OPT Description: Measurement of dry mass range: String Example: 500 gram None host_genotype OPT Description: Observed genotype range: String Example: C57BL/6 None host_height OPT Description: The height of subject range: String Example: 0.1 meter None host_infra_specific_name OPT Description: Taxonomic information about the host below subspecies level range: String Example: borealis None host_infra_specific_rank OPT Description: Taxonomic rank information about the host below subspecies level, such as variety, form, rank etc. range: String Example: subspecies None host_length OPT Description: The length of subject range: String Example: 1 meter None host_life_stage OPT Description: Description of life stage of host range: String Example: adult None host_phenotype OPT Description: Phenotype of human or other host. For phenotypic quality ontology (pato) (v 2018-03-27) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/pato. For Human Phenotype Ontology (HP) (v 2018-06-13) please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/HP range: String Example: elongated [PATO:0001154] None host_taxid OPT Description: NCBI taxon id of the host, e.g. 9606 range: String Example: 7955 None host_tot_mass OPT Description: Total mass of the host at collection, the unit depends on host range: String Example: 2500 gram None host_wet_mass OPT Description: Measurement of wet mass range: String Example: 1500 gram None humidity_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment involving an exposure to varying degree of humidity; information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include amount of humidity administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens range: String Example: 25 gram per cubic meter;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None light_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment(s) involving exposure to light, including both light intensity and quality. range: String Example: incandescant light;10 lux;450 nanometer None mechanical_damage OPT Description: Information about any mechanical damage exerted on the plant; can include multiple damages and sites range: String Example: pruning;bark None mineral_nutr_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment involving the use of mineral supplements; should include the name of mineral nutrient, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple mineral nutrient regimens range: String Example: potassium;15 gram;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None misc_param OPT Description: Any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here range: String Example: Bicarbonate ion concentration;2075 micromole per kilogram None non_mineral_nutr_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment involving the exposure of plant to non-mineral nutrient such as oxygen, hydrogen or carbon; should include the name of non-mineral nutrient, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple non-mineral nutrient regimens range: String Example: carbon dioxide;10 mole per liter;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None organism_count OPT Description: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) Should also be provided. (example: total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qpcr) range: String Example: total prokaryotes;3.5e7 cells per milliliter;qPCR None oxy_stat_samp OPT Description: Oxygenation status of sample range: String Example: aerobic None perturbation OPT Description: Type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with perturbation regimen including how many times the perturbation was repeated, how long each perturbation lasted, and the start and end time of the entire perturbation period; can include multiple perturbation types range: String Example: antibiotic addition;R2/2018-05-11T14:30Z/2018-05-11T19:30Z/P1H30M None pesticide_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment involving use of insecticides; should include the name of pesticide, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple pesticide regimens range: String Example: pyrethrum;0.6 milligram per liter;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None ph_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment involving exposure of plants to varying levels of ph of the growth media, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimen range: String Example: 7.6;R2/2018-05-11:T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None plant_growth_med OPT Description: Specification of the media for growing the plants or tissue cultured samples, e.g. soil, aeroponic, hydroponic, in vitro solid culture medium, in vitro liquid culture medium. Recommended value is a specific value from EO:plant growth medium (follow this link for terms http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/EO_0007147) or other controlled vocabulary range: String Example: hydroponic plant culture media [EO:0007067] None plant_product OPT Description: Substance produced by the plant, where the sample was obtained from range: String Example: xylem sap [PO:0025539] None plant_sex OPT Description: Sex of the reproductive parts on the whole plant, e.g. pistillate, staminate, monoecieous, hermaphrodite. range: String Example: Hermaphroditic None plant_struc OPT Description: Name of plant structure the sample was obtained from; for Plant Ontology (PO) (v releases/2017-12-14) terms, see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PO, e.g. petiole epidermis (PO_0000051). If an individual flower is sampled, the sex of it can be recorded here. range: String Example: epidermis [PO:0005679] None radiation_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment involving exposure of plant or a plant part to a particular radiation regimen; should include the radiation type, amount or intensity administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple radiation regimens range: String Example: gamma radiation;60 gray;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None rainfall_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment involving an exposure to a given amount of rainfall, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens range: String Example: 15 millimeter;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None root_cond OPT Description: Relevant rooting conditions such as field plot size, sowing density, container dimensions, number of plants per container. range: String Example: http://himedialabs.com/TD/PT158.pdf None root_med_carbon OPT Description: Source of organic carbon in the culture rooting medium; e.g. sucrose. range: String Example: sucrose None root_med_macronutr OPT Description: Measurement of the culture rooting medium macronutrients (N,P, K, Ca, Mg, S); e.g. KH2PO4 (170¬†mg/L). range: String Example: KH2PO4;170¬†milligram per liter None root_med_micronutr OPT Description: Measurement of the culture rooting medium micronutrients (Fe, Mn, Zn, B, Cu, Mo); e.g. H3BO3 (6.2¬†mg/L). range: String Example: H3BO3;6.2¬†milligram per liter None root_med_ph OPT Description: pH measurement of the culture rooting medium; e.g. 5.5. range: String Example: 7.5 None root_med_regl OPT Description: Growth regulators in the culture rooting medium such as cytokinins, auxins, gybberellins, abscisic acid; e.g. 0.5¬†mg/L NAA. range: String Example: abscisic acid;0.75 milligram per liter None root_med_solid OPT Description: Specification of the solidifying agent in the culture rooting medium; e.g. agar. range: String Example: agar None root_med_suppl OPT Description: Organic supplements of the culture rooting medium, such as vitamins, amino acids, organic acids, antibiotics activated charcoal; e.g. nicotinic acid (0.5¬†mg/L). range: String Example: nicotinic acid;0.5 milligram per liter None salt_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment involving use of salts as supplement to liquid and soil growth media; should include the name of salt, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple salt regimens range: String Example: NaCl;5 gram per liter;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None samp_capt_status OPT Description: Reason for the sample range: String Example: farm sample None samp_dis_stage OPT Description: Stage of the disease at the time of sample collection, e.g. inoculation, penetration, infection, growth and reproduction, dissemination of pathogen. range: String Example: infection None samp_salinity OPT Description: Salinity is the total concentration of all dissolved salts in a liquid or solid (in the form of an extract obtained by centrifugation) sample. While salinity can be measured by a complete chemical analysis, this method is difficult and time consuming. More often, it is instead derived from the conductivity measurement. This is known as practical salinity. These derivations compare the specific conductance of the sample to a salinity standard such as seawater range: String Example: 1 milligram per liter None samp_store_dur OPT Description: Duration for which the sample was stored range: String Example: P1Y6M None samp_store_loc OPT Description: Location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room range: String Example: Freezer no:5 None samp_store_temp OPT Description: Temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80 degree Celsius range: String Example: -80 degree Celsius None samp_vol_we_dna_ext OPT Description: Volume (ml), weight (g) of processed sample, or surface area swabbed from sample for DNA extraction range: String Example: 1500 milliliter None season_environment OPT Description: Treatment involving an exposure to a particular season (e.g. Winter, summer, rabi, rainy etc.), treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment range: String Example: rainy;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None standing_water_regm OPT Description: Treatment involving an exposure to standing water during a plant's life span, types can be flood water or standing water, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens range: String Example: standing water;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None temp OPT Description: Temperature of the sample at the time of sampling range: String Example: 25 degree Celsius None tiss_cult_growth_med OPT Description: Description of plant tissue culture growth media used range: String Example: https://link.springer.com/content/pdf/10.1007/BF02796489.pdf None water_temp_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment involving an exposure to water with varying degree of temperature, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens range: String Example: 15 degree Celsius;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None watering_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment involving an exposure to watering frequencies, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens range: String Example: 1 liter;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None

docs.title: Type: plant-associated

docs.text: air_temp_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment involving an exposure to varying temperatures; should include the temperature, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include different temperature regimens range: String Example: 25 degree Celsius;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None ances_data OPT Description: Information about either pedigree or other ancestral information description (e.g. parental variety in case of mutant or selection), e.g. A/3*B (meaning [(A x B) x B] x B) range: String Example: A/3*B None antibiotic_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment involving antibiotic administration; should include the name of antibiotic, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple antibiotic regimens range: String Example: penicillin;5 milligram;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None biol_stat OPT Description: The level of genome modification range: String Example: natural None biotic_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment(s) involving use of biotic factors, such as bacteria, viruses or fungi. range: String Example: sample inoculated with Rhizobium spp. Culture None chem_administration OPT Description: List of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. Antibiotics, n fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For chemical entities of biological interest ontology (chebi) (v 163), http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/chebi range: String Example: agar [CHEBI:2509];2018-05-11T20:00Z None chem_mutagen OPT Description: Treatment involving use of mutagens; should include the name of mutagen, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple mutagen regimens range: String Example: nitrous acid;0.5 milligram per liter;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None climate_environment OPT Description: Treatment involving an exposure to a particular climate; treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple climates range: String Example: tropical climate;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None cult_root_med OPT Description: Name or reference for the hydroponic or in vitro culture rooting medium; can be the name of a commonly used medium or reference to a specific medium, e.g. Murashige and Skoog medium. If the medium has not been formally published, use the rooting medium descriptors. range: String Example: http://himedialabs.com/TD/PT158.pdf None fertilizer_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment involving the use of fertilizers; should include the name of fertilizer, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple fertilizer regimens range: String Example: urea;0.6 milligram per liter;R2/2018-05-11:T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None fungicide_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment involving use of fungicides; should include the name of fungicide, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple fungicide regimens range: String Example: bifonazole;1 mole per liter;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None gaseous_environment OPT Description: Use of conditions with differing gaseous environments; should include the name of gaseous compound, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple gaseous environment regimens range: String Example: nitric oxide;0.5 micromole per liter;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None genetic_mod OPT Description: Genetic modifications of the genome of an organism, which may occur naturally by spontaneous mutation, or be introduced by some experimental means, e.g. specification of a transgene or the gene knocked-out or details of transient transfection range: String Example: aox1A transgenic None gravity OPT Description: Information about treatment involving use of gravity factor to study various types of responses in presence, absence or modified levels of gravity; treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple treatments range: String Example: 12 g;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None growth_facil OPT Description: Type of facility where the sampled plant was grown; controlled vocabulary: growth chamber, open top chamber, glasshouse, experimental garden, field. Alternatively use Crop Ontology (CO) terms, see http://www.cropontology.org/ontology/CO_715/Crop%20Research range: String Example: Growth chamber [CO_715:0000189] None growth_habit OPT Description: Characteristic shape, appearance or growth form of a plant species range: String Example: spreading None growth_hormone_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include the name of growth hormone, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple growth hormone regimens range: String Example: abscisic acid;0.5 milligram per liter;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None herbicide_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment involving use of herbicides; information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include the name of herbicide, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens range: String Example: atrazine;10 milligram per liter;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None host_age OPT Description: Age of host at the time of sampling; relevant scale depends on species and study, e.g. Could be seconds for amoebae or centuries for trees range: String Example: 10 days None host_common_name OPT Description: Common name of the host, e.g. Human range: String Example: mussel None host_disease_stat OPT Description: List of diseases with which the host has been diagnosed; can include multiple diagnoses. The value of the field depends on host; for humans the terms should be chosen from the DO (Human Disease Ontology) at https://www.disease-ontology.org, non-human host diseases are free text range: String Example: rabies [DOID:11260] None host_dry_mass OPT Description: Measurement of dry mass range: String Example: 500 gram None host_genotype OPT Description: Observed genotype range: String Example: C57BL/6 None host_height OPT Description: The height of subject range: String Example: 0.1 meter None host_infra_specific_name OPT Description: Taxonomic information about the host below subspecies level range: String Example: borealis None host_infra_specific_rank OPT Description: Taxonomic rank information about the host below subspecies level, such as variety, form, rank etc. range: String Example: subspecies None host_length OPT Description: The length of subject range: String Example: 1 meter None host_life_stage OPT Description: Description of life stage of host range: String Example: adult None host_phenotype OPT Description: Phenotype of human or other host. For phenotypic quality ontology (pato) (v 2018-03-27) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/pato. For Human Phenotype Ontology (HP) (v 2018-06-13) please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/HP range: String Example: elongated [PATO:0001154] None host_taxid OPT Description: NCBI taxon id of the host, e.g. 9606 range: String Example: 7955 None host_tot_mass OPT Description: Total mass of the host at collection, the unit depends on host range: String Example: 2500 gram None host_wet_mass OPT Description: Measurement of wet mass range: String Example: 1500 gram None humidity_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment involving an exposure to varying degree of humidity; information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include amount of humidity administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens range: String Example: 25 gram per cubic meter;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None light_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment(s) involving exposure to light, including both light intensity and quality. range: String Example: incandescant light;10 lux;450 nanometer None mechanical_damage OPT Description: Information about any mechanical damage exerted on the plant; can include multiple damages and sites range: String Example: pruning;bark None mineral_nutr_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment involving the use of mineral supplements; should include the name of mineral nutrient, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple mineral nutrient regimens range: String Example: potassium;15 gram;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None misc_param OPT Description: Any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here range: String Example: Bicarbonate ion concentration;2075 micromole per kilogram None non_mineral_nutr_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment involving the exposure of plant to non-mineral nutrient such as oxygen, hydrogen or carbon; should include the name of non-mineral nutrient, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple non-mineral nutrient regimens range: String Example: carbon dioxide;10 mole per liter;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None organism_count OPT Description: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) Should also be provided. (example: total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qpcr) range: String Example: total prokaryotes;3.5e7 cells per milliliter;qPCR None oxy_stat_samp OPT Description: Oxygenation status of sample range: String Example: aerobic None perturbation OPT Description: Type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with perturbation regimen including how many times the perturbation was repeated, how long each perturbation lasted, and the start and end time of the entire perturbation period; can include multiple perturbation types range: String Example: antibiotic addition;R2/2018-05-11T14:30Z/2018-05-11T19:30Z/P1H30M None pesticide_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment involving use of insecticides; should include the name of pesticide, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple pesticide regimens range: String Example: pyrethrum;0.6 milligram per liter;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None ph_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment involving exposure of plants to varying levels of ph of the growth media, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimen range: String Example: 7.6;R2/2018-05-11:T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None plant_growth_med OPT Description: Specification of the media for growing the plants or tissue cultured samples, e.g. soil, aeroponic, hydroponic, in vitro solid culture medium, in vitro liquid culture medium. Recommended value is a specific value from EO:plant growth medium (follow this link for terms http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/EO_0007147) or other controlled vocabulary range: String Example: hydroponic plant culture media [EO:0007067] None plant_product OPT Description: Substance produced by the plant, where the sample was obtained from range: String Example: xylem sap [PO:0025539] None plant_sex OPT Description: Sex of the reproductive parts on the whole plant, e.g. pistillate, staminate, monoecieous, hermaphrodite. range: String Example: Hermaphroditic None plant_struc OPT Description: Name of plant structure the sample was obtained from; for Plant Ontology (PO) (v releases/2017-12-14) terms, see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PO, e.g. petiole epidermis (PO_0000051). If an individual flower is sampled, the sex of it can be recorded here. range: String Example: epidermis [PO:0005679] None radiation_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment involving exposure of plant or a plant part to a particular radiation regimen; should include the radiation type, amount or intensity administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple radiation regimens range: String Example: gamma radiation;60 gray;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None rainfall_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment involving an exposure to a given amount of rainfall, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens range: String Example: 15 millimeter;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None root_cond OPT Description: Relevant rooting conditions such as field plot size, sowing density, container dimensions, number of plants per container. range: String Example: http://himedialabs.com/TD/PT158.pdf None root_med_carbon OPT Description: Source of organic carbon in the culture rooting medium; e.g. sucrose. range: String Example: sucrose None root_med_macronutr OPT Description: Measurement of the culture rooting medium macronutrients (N,P, K, Ca, Mg, S); e.g. KH2PO4 (170¬†mg/L). range: String Example: KH2PO4;170¬†milligram per liter None root_med_micronutr OPT Description: Measurement of the culture rooting medium micronutrients (Fe, Mn, Zn, B, Cu, Mo); e.g. H3BO3 (6.2¬†mg/L). range: String Example: H3BO3;6.2¬†milligram per liter None root_med_ph OPT Description: pH measurement of the culture rooting medium; e.g. 5.5. range: String Example: 7.5 None root_med_regl OPT Description: Growth regulators in the culture rooting medium such as cytokinins, auxins, gybberellins, abscisic acid; e.g. 0.5¬†mg/L NAA. range: String Example: abscisic acid;0.75 milligram per liter None root_med_solid OPT Description: Specification of the solidifying agent in the culture rooting medium; e.g. agar. range: String Example: agar None root_med_suppl OPT Description: Organic supplements of the culture rooting medium, such as vitamins, amino acids, organic acids, antibiotics activated charcoal; e.g. nicotinic acid (0.5¬†mg/L). range: String Example: nicotinic acid;0.5 milligram per liter None salt_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment involving use of salts as supplement to liquid and soil growth media; should include the name of salt, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple salt regimens range: String Example: NaCl;5 gram per liter;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None samp_capt_status OPT Description: Reason for the sample range: String Example: farm sample None samp_dis_stage OPT Description: Stage of the disease at the time of sample collection, e.g. inoculation, penetration, infection, growth and reproduction, dissemination of pathogen. range: String Example: infection None samp_salinity OPT Description: Salinity is the total concentration of all dissolved salts in a liquid or solid (in the form of an extract obtained by centrifugation) sample. While salinity can be measured by a complete chemical analysis, this method is difficult and time consuming. More often, it is instead derived from the conductivity measurement. This is known as practical salinity. These derivations compare the specific conductance of the sample to a salinity standard such as seawater range: String Example: 1 milligram per liter None samp_store_dur OPT Description: Duration for which the sample was stored range: String Example: P1Y6M None samp_store_loc OPT Description: Location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room range: String Example: Freezer no:5 None samp_store_temp OPT Description: Temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80 degree Celsius range: String Example: -80 degree Celsius None samp_vol_we_dna_ext OPT Description: Volume (ml), weight (g) of processed sample, or surface area swabbed from sample for DNA extraction range: String Example: 1500 milliliter None season_environment OPT Description: Treatment involving an exposure to a particular season (e.g. Winter, summer, rabi, rainy etc.), treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment range: String Example: rainy;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None standing_water_regm OPT Description: Treatment involving an exposure to standing water during a plant's life span, types can be flood water or standing water, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens range: String Example: standing water;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None temp OPT Description: Temperature of the sample at the time of sampling range: String Example: 25 degree Celsius None tiss_cult_growth_med OPT Description: Description of plant tissue culture growth media used range: String Example: https://link.springer.com/content/pdf/10.1007/BF02796489.pdf None water_temp_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment involving an exposure to water with varying degree of temperature, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens range: String Example: 15 degree Celsius;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None watering_regm OPT Description: Information about treatment involving an exposure to watering frequencies, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens range: String Example: 1 liter;R2/2018-05-11T14:30/2018-05-11T19:30/P1H30M None
docs.title: Own

docs.text: Type: sediment sediment URI: mixs.vocab:Sediment Attributes Own alkalinity OPT Description: Alkalinity, the ability of a solution to neutralize acids to the equivalence point of carbonate or bicarbonate range: String Example: 50 milligram per liter None alkyl_diethers OPT Description: Concentration of alkyl diethers range: String Example: 0.005 mole per liter None aminopept_act OPT Description: Measurement of aminopeptidase activity range: String Example: 0.269 mole per liter per hour None ammonium OPT Description: Concentration of ammonium in the sample range: String Example: 1.5 milligram per liter None bacteria_carb_prod OPT Description: Measurement of bacterial carbon production range: String Example: 2.53 microgram per liter per hour None biomass OPT Description: Amount of biomass; should include the name for the part of biomass measured, e.g. Microbial, total. Can include multiple measurements range: String Example: total;20 gram None bishomohopanol OPT Description: Concentration of bishomohopanol range: String Example: 14 microgram per liter None bromide OPT Description: Concentration of bromide range: String Example: 0.05 parts per million None calcium OPT Description: Concentration of calcium in the sample range: String Example: 0.2 micromole per liter None carb_nitro_ratio OPT Description: Ratio of amount or concentrations of carbon to nitrogen range: String Example: 0.417361111 None chem_administration OPT Description: List of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. Antibiotics, n fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For chemical entities of biological interest ontology (chebi) (v 163), http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/chebi range: String Example: agar [CHEBI:2509];2018-05-11T20:00Z None chloride OPT Description: Concentration of chloride in the sample range: String Example: 5000 milligram per liter None chlorophyll OPT Description: Concentration of chlorophyll range: String Example: 5 milligram per cubic meter None density OPT Description: Density of the sample, which is its mass per unit volume (aka volumetric mass density) range: String Example: 1000 kilogram per cubic meter None diether_lipids OPT Description: Concentration of diether lipids; can include multiple types of diether lipids range: String Example: 0.2 nanogram per liter None diss_carb_dioxide OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved carbon dioxide in the sample or liquid portion of the sample range: String Example: 5 milligram per liter None diss_hydrogen OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved hydrogen range: String Example: 0.3 micromole per liter None diss_inorg_carb OPT Description: Dissolved inorganic carbon concentration in the sample, typically measured after filtering the sample using a 0.45 micrometer filter range: String Example: 2059 micromole per kilogram None diss_org_carb OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved organic carbon in the sample, liquid portion of the sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid range: String Example: 197 micromole per liter None diss_org_nitro OPT Description: Dissolved organic nitrogen concentration measured as; total dissolved nitrogen - NH4 - NO3 - NO2 range: String Example: 0.05 micromole per liter None diss_oxygen OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved oxygen range: String Example: 175 micromole per kilogram None glucosidase_act OPT Description: Measurement of glucosidase activity range: String Example: 5 mol per liter per hour None magnesium OPT Description: Concentration of magnesium in the sample range: String Example: 52.8 micromole per kilogram None mean_frict_vel OPT Description: Measurement of mean friction velocity range: String Example: 0.5 meter per second None mean_peak_frict_vel OPT Description: Measurement of mean peak friction velocity range: String Example: 1 meter per second None methane OPT Description: Methane (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling range: String Example: 1800 parts per billion None misc_param OPT Description: Any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here range: String Example: Bicarbonate ion concentration;2075 micromole per kilogram None n_alkanes OPT Description: Concentration of n-alkanes; can include multiple n-alkanes range: String Example: n-hexadecane;100 milligram per liter None nitrate OPT Description: Concentration of nitrate in the sample range: String Example: 65 micromole per liter None nitrite OPT Description: Concentration of nitrite in the sample range: String Example: 0.5 micromole per liter None nitro OPT Description: Concentration of nitrogen (total) range: String Example: 4.2 micromole per liter None org_carb OPT Description: Concentration of organic carbon range: String Example: 1.5 microgram per liter None org_matter OPT Description: Concentration of organic matter range: String Example: 1.75 milligram per cubic meter None org_nitro OPT Description: Concentration of organic nitrogen range: String Example: 4 micromole per liter None organism_count OPT Description: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) Should also be provided. (example: total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qpcr) range: String Example: total prokaryotes;3.5e7 cells per milliliter;qPCR None oxy_stat_samp OPT Description: Oxygenation status of sample range: String Example: aerobic None part_org_carb OPT Description: Concentration of particulate organic carbon range: String Example: 1.92 micromole per liter None particle_class OPT Description: Particles are classified, based on their size, into six general categories:clay, silt, sand, gravel, cobbles, and boulders; should include amount of particle preceded by the name of the particle type; can include multiple values range: String Example: None perturbation OPT Description: Type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with perturbation regimen including how many times the perturbation was repeated, how long each perturbation lasted, and the start and end time of the entire perturbation period; can include multiple perturbation types range: String Example: antibiotic addition;R2/2018-05-11T14:30Z/2018-05-11T19:30Z/P1H30M None petroleum_hydrocarb OPT Description: Concentration of petroleum hydrocarbon range: String Example: 0.05 micromole per liter None ph OPT Description: Ph measurement of the sample, or liquid portion of sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid range: String Example: 7.2 None phaeopigments OPT Description: Concentration of phaeopigments; can include multiple phaeopigments range: String Example: 2.5 milligram per cubic meter None phosphate OPT Description: Concentration of phosphate range: String Example: 0.7 micromole per liter None phosplipid_fatt_acid OPT Description: Concentration of phospholipid fatty acids; can include multiple values range: String Example: 2.98 milligram per liter None porosity OPT Description: Porosity of deposited sediment is volume of voids divided by the total volume of sample range: String Example: None potassium OPT Description: Concentration of potassium in the sample range: String Example: 463 milligram per liter None pressure OPT Description: Pressure to which the sample is subject to, in atmospheres range: String Example: 50 atmosphere None redox_potential OPT Description: Redox potential, measured relative to a hydrogen cell, indicating oxidation or reduction potential range: String Example: 300 millivolt None salinity OPT Description: Salinity is the total concentration of all dissolved salts in a water sample. While salinity can be measured by a complete chemical analysis, this method is difficult and time consuming. More often, it is instead derived from the conductivity measurement. This is known as practical salinity. These derivations compare the specific conductance of the sample to a salinity standard such as seawater range: String Example: 25 practical salinity unit None samp_store_dur OPT Description: Duration for which the sample was stored range: String Example: P1Y6M None samp_store_loc OPT Description: Location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room range: String Example: Freezer no:5 None samp_store_temp OPT Description: Temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80 degree Celsius range: String Example: -80 degree Celsius None samp_vol_we_dna_ext OPT Description: Volume (ml), weight (g) of processed sample, or surface area swabbed from sample for DNA extraction range: String Example: 1500 milliliter None sediment_type OPT Description: Information about the sediment type based on major constituents range: String Example: biogenous None silicate OPT Description: Concentration of silicate range: String Example: 0.05 micromole per liter None sodium OPT Description: Sodium concentration in the sample range: String Example: 10.5 milligram per liter None sulfate OPT Description: Concentration of sulfate in the sample range: String Example: 5 micromole per liter None sulfide OPT Description: Concentration of sulfide in the sample range: String Example: 2 micromole per liter None temp OPT Description: Temperature of the sample at the time of sampling range: String Example: 25 degree Celsius None tidal_stage OPT Description: Stage of tide range: String Example: high tide None tot_carb OPT Description: Total carbon content range: String Example: Can include multiple measurements range: String Example: total;20 gram None bishomohopanol OPT Description: Concentration of bishomohopanol range: String Example: 14 microgram per liter None bromide OPT Description: Concentration of bromide range: String Example: 0.05 parts per million None calcium OPT Description: Concentration of calcium in the sample range: String Example: 0.2 micromole per liter None carb_nitro_ratio OPT Description: Ratio of amount or concentrations of carbon to nitrogen range: String Example: 0.417361111 None chem_administration OPT Description: List of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. Antibiotics, n fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For chemical entities of biological interest ontology (chebi) (v 163), http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/chebi range: String Example: agar [CHEBI:2509];2018-05-11T20:00Z None chloride OPT Description: Concentration of chloride in the sample range: String Example: 5000 milligram per liter None chlorophyll OPT Description: Concentration of chlorophyll range: String Example: 5 milligram per cubic meter None density OPT Description: Density of the sample, which is its mass per unit volume (aka volumetric mass density) range: String Example: 1000 kilogram per cubic meter None diether_lipids OPT Description: Concentration of diether lipids; can include multiple types of diether lipids range: String Example: 0.2 nanogram per liter None diss_carb_dioxide OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved carbon dioxide in the sample or liquid portion of the sample range: String Example: 5 milligram per liter None diss_hydrogen OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved hydrogen range: String Example: 0.3 micromole per liter None diss_inorg_carb OPT Description: Dissolved inorganic carbon concentration in the sample, typically measured after filtering the sample using a 0.45 micrometer filter range: String Example: 2059 micromole per kilogram None diss_org_carb OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved organic carbon in the sample, liquid portion of the sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid range: String Example: 197 micromole per liter None diss_org_nitro OPT Description: Dissolved organic nitrogen concentration measured as; total dissolved nitrogen - NH4 - NO3 - NO2 range: String Example: 0.05 micromole per liter None diss_oxygen OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved oxygen range: String Example: 175 micromole per kilogram None glucosidase_act OPT Description: Measurement of glucosidase activity range: String Example: 5 mol per liter per hour None magnesium OPT Description: Concentration of magnesium in the sample range: String Example: 52.8 micromole per kilogram None mean_frict_vel OPT Description: Measurement of mean friction velocity range: String Example: 0.5 meter per second None mean_peak_frict_vel OPT Description: Measurement of mean peak friction velocity range: String Example: 1 meter per second None methane OPT Description: Methane (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling range: String Example: 1800 parts per billion None misc_param OPT Description: Any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here range: String Example: Bicarbonate ion concentration;2075 micromole per kilogram None n_alkanes OPT Description: Concentration of n-alkanes; can include multiple n-alkanes range: String Example: n-hexadecane;100 milligram per liter None nitrate OPT Description: Concentration of nitrate in the sample range: String Example: 65 micromole per liter None nitrite OPT Description: Concentration of nitrite in the sample range: String Example: 0.5 micromole per liter None nitro OPT Description: Concentration of nitrogen (total) range: String Example: 4.2 micromole per liter None org_carb OPT Description: Concentration of organic carbon range: String Example: 1.5 microgram per liter None org_matter OPT Description: Concentration of organic matter range: String Example: 1.75 milligram per cubic meter None org_nitro OPT Description: Concentration of organic nitrogen range: String Example: 4 micromole per liter None organism_count OPT Description: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) Should also be provided. (example: total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qpcr) range: String Example: total prokaryotes;3.5e7 cells per milliliter;qPCR None oxy_stat_samp OPT Description: Oxygenation status of sample range: String Example: aerobic None part_org_carb OPT Description: Concentration of particulate organic carbon range: String Example: 1.92 micromole per liter None particle_class OPT Description: Particles are classified, based on their size, into six general categories:clay, silt, sand, gravel, cobbles, and boulders; should include amount of particle preceded by the name of the particle type; can include multiple values range: String Example: None perturbation OPT Description: Type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with perturbation regimen including how many times the perturbation was repeated, how long each perturbation lasted, and the start and end time of the entire perturbation period; can include multiple perturbation types range: String Example: antibiotic addition;R2/2018-05-11T14:30Z/2018-05-11T19:30Z/P1H30M None petroleum_hydrocarb OPT Description: Concentration of petroleum hydrocarbon range: String Example: 0.05 micromole per liter None ph OPT Description: Ph measurement of the sample, or liquid portion of sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid range: String Example: 7.2 None phaeopigments OPT Description: Concentration of phaeopigments; can include multiple values range: String Example: 2.98 milligram per liter None porosity OPT Description: Porosity of deposited sediment is volume of voids divided by the total volume of sample range: String Example: None potassium OPT Description: Concentration of potassium in the sample range: String Example: 463 milligram per liter None pressure OPT Description: Pressure to which the sample is subject to, in atmospheres range: String Example: 50 atmosphere None redox_potential OPT Description: Redox potential, measured relative to a hydrogen cell, indicating oxidation or reduction potential range: String Example: 300 millivolt None salinity OPT Description: Salinity is the total concentration of all dissolved salts in a water sample. While salinity can be measured by a complete chemical analysis, this method is difficult and time consuming. More often, it is instead derived from the conductivity measurement. docs.text: Type: soil soil URI: mixs.vocab:Soil Attributes Own agrochem_addition OPT Description: Addition of fertilizers, pesticides, etc. - amount and time of applications range: String Example: roundup;5 milligram per liter;2018-06-21 None al_sat OPT Description: Aluminum saturation (esp. For tropical soils) range: String Example: None al_sat_meth OPT Description: Reference or method used in determining Al saturation range: String Example: None annual_precpt OPT Description: The average of all annual precipitation values known, or an estimated equivalent value derived by such methods as regional indexes or Isohyetal maps. range: String Example: None annual_temp OPT Description: Mean annual temperature range: String Example: 12.5 degree Celsius None crop_rotation OPT Description: Whether or not crop is rotated, and if yes, rotation schedule range: String Example: yes;R2/2017-01-01/2018-12-31/P6M None cur_land_use OPT Description: Present state of sample site range: String Example: conifers None cur_vegetation OPT Description: Vegetation classification from one or more standard classification systems, or agricultural crop range: String Example: None cur_vegetation_meth OPT Description: Reference or method used in vegetation classification range: String Example: None drainage_class OPT Description: Drainage classification from a standard system such as the USDA system range: String Example: well None extreme_event OPT Description: Unusual physical events that may have affected microbial populations range: String Example: None extreme_salinity OPT Description: Measured salinity range: String Example: None fao_class OPT Description: Soil classification from the FAO World Reference Database for Soil Resources. The list can be found at http://www.fao.org/nr/land/sols/soil/wrb-soil-maps/reference-groups range: String Example: Luvisols None fire OPT Description: Historical and/or physical evidence of fire range: String Example: None flooding OPT Description: Historical and/or physical evidence of flooding range: String Example: None heavy_metals OPT Description: Heavy metals present and concentrationsany drug used by subject and the frequency of usage; can include multiple heavy metals and concentrations range: String Example: None heavy_metals_meth OPT Description: Reference or method used in determining heavy metals range: String Example: None horizon OPT Description: Specific layer in the land area which measures parallel to the soil surface and possesses physical characteristics which differ from the layers above and beneath range: String Example: A horizon None horizon_meth OPT Description: Reference or method used in determining the horizon range: String Example: None link_addit_analys OPT Description: Link to additional analysis results performed on the sample range: String Example: None link_class_info OPT Description: Link to digitized soil maps or other soil classification information range: String Example: None link_climate_info OPT Description: Link to climate resource range: String Example: None local_class OPT Description: Soil classification based on local soil classification system range: String Example: None local_class_meth OPT Description: Reference or method used in determining the local soil classification range: String Example: None microbial_biomass OPT Description: The part of the organic matter in the soil that constitutes living microorganisms smaller than 5-10 micrometer. If you keep this, you would need to have correction factors used for conversion to the final units range: String Example: None microbial_biomass_meth OPT Description: Reference or method used in determining microbial biomass range: String Example: None misc_param OPT Description: Any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here range: String Example: Bicarbonate ion concentration;2075 micromole per kilogram None ph OPT Description: Ph measurement of the sample, or liquid portion of sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid range: String Example: 7.2 None ph_meth OPT Description: Reference or method used in determining ph range: String Example: None pool_dna_extracts OPT Description: Indicate whether multiple DNA extractions were mixed. If the answer yes, the number of extracts that were pooled should be given range: String Example: yes;5 None previous_land_use OPT Description: Previous land use and dates range: String Example: None previous_land_use_meth OPT Description: Reference or method used in determining previous land use and dates range: String Example: None profile_position OPT Description: Cross-sectional position in the hillslope where sample was collected.sample area position in relation to surrounding areas range: String Example: summit None salinity_meth OPT Description: Reference or method used in determining salinity range: String Example: None samp_vol_we_dna_ext OPT Description: Volume (ml), weight (g) of processed sample, or surface area swabbed from sample for DNA extraction range: String Example: 1500 milliliter None season_precpt OPT Description: The average of all seasonal precipitation values known, or an estimated equivalent value derived by such methods as regional indexes or Isohyetal maps. range: String Example: None season_temp OPT Description: Mean seasonal temperature range: String Example: 18 degree Celsius None sieving OPT Description: Collection design of pooled samples and/or sieve size and amount of sample sieved range: String Example: None slope_aspect OPT Description: The direction a slope faces. While looking down a slope use a compass to record the direction you are facing (direction or degrees); e.g., nw or 315 degrees. This measure provides an indication of sun and wind exposure that will influence soil temperature and evapotranspiration. range: String Example: None slope_gradient OPT Description: Commonly called 'slope'. The angle between ground surface and a horizontal line (in percent). This is the direction that overland water would flow. This measure is usually taken with a hand level meter or clinometer range: String Example: None soil_type OPT Description: Soil series name or other lower-level classification range: String Example: None soil_type_meth OPT Description: Reference or method used in determining soil series name or other lower-level classification range: String Example: None store_cond OPT Description: Explain how and for how long the soil sample was stored before DNA extraction range: String Example: -20 degree Celsius freezer;P2Y10D None texture OPT Description: The relative proportion of different grain sizes of mineral particles in a soil, as described using a standard system; express as % sand (50 um to 2 mm), silt (2 um to 50 um), and clay (<2 um) with textural name (e.g., silty clay loam) optional. range: String Example: None texture_meth OPT Description: Reference or method used in determining soil texture range: String Example: None tillage OPT Description: Note method(s) used for tilling range: String Example: chisel None tot_nitro_content OPT Description: Total nitrogen content of the sample range: String Example: None tot_nitro_content_meth OPT Description: Reference or method used in determining the total nitrogen range: String Example: None tot_org_c_meth OPT Description: Reference or method used in determining total organic carbon range: String Example: None tot_org_carb OPT Description: Definition for soil: total organic carbon content of the soil, definition otherwise: total organic carbon content range: String Example: None water_content OPT Description: Water content measurement range: String Example: None water_content_soil_meth OPT Description: Reference or method used in determining the water content of soil range: String Example: None

docs.text: Type: wastewater_sludge wastewater/sludge URI: mixs.vocab:WastewaterSludge Attributes Own alkalinity OPT Description: Alkalinity, the ability of a solution to neutralize acids to the equivalence point of carbonate or bicarbonate range: String Example: 50 milligram per liter None biochem_oxygen_dem OPT Description: Amount of dissolved oxygen needed by aerobic biological organisms in a body of water to break down organic material present in a given water sample at certain temperature over a specific time period range: String Example: None chem_administration OPT Description: List of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. Antibiotics, n fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For chemical entities of biological interest ontology (chebi) (v 163), http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/chebi range: String Example: agar [CHEBI:2509];2018-05-11T20:00Z None chem_oxygen_dem OPT Description: A measure of the capacity of water to consume oxygen during the decomposition of organic matter and the oxidation of inorganic chemicals such as ammonia and nitrite range: String Example: None efficiency_percent OPT Description: Percentage of volatile solids removed from the anaerobic digestor range: String Example: None emulsions OPT Description: Amount or concentration of substances such as paints, adhesives, mayonnaise, hair colorants, emulsified oils, etc.; can include multiple emulsion types range: String Example: None gaseous_substances OPT Description: Amount or concentration of substances such as hydrogen sulfide, carbon dioxide, methane, etc.; can include multiple substances range: String Example: None indust_eff_percent OPT Description: Percentage of industrial effluents received by wastewater treatment plant range: String Example: None inorg_particles OPT Description: Concentration of particles such as sand, grit, metal particles, ceramics, etc.; can include multiple particles range: String Example: None misc_param OPT Description: Any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here range: String Example: Bicarbonate ion concentration;2075 micromole per kilogram None nitrate OPT Description: Concentration of nitrate in the sample range: String Example: 65 micromole per liter None org_particles OPT Description: Concentration of particles such as faeces, hairs, food, vomit, paper fibers, plant material, humus, etc. range: String Example: None organism_count OPT Description: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) Should also be provided. (example: total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qpcr) range: String Example: total prokaryotes;3.5e7 cells per milliliter;qPCR None oxy_stat_samp OPT Description: Oxygenation status of sample range: String Example: aerobic None perturbation OPT Description: Type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with perturbation regimen including how many times the perturbation was repeated, how long each perturbation lasted, and the start and end time of the entire perturbation period; can include multiple perturbation types range: String Example: antibiotic addition;R2/2018-05-11T14:30Z/2018-05-11T19:30Z/P1H30M None ph OPT Description: Ph measurement of the sample, or liquid portion of sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid range: String Example: 7.2 None phosphate OPT Description: Concentration of phosphate range: String Example: 0.7 micromole per liter None pre_treatment OPT Description: The process of pre-treatment removes materials that can be easily collected from the raw wastewater range: String Example: None primary_treatment OPT Description: The process to produce both a generally homogeneous liquid capable of being treated biologically and a sludge that can be separately treated or processed range: String Example: None reactor_type OPT Description: Anaerobic digesters can be designed and engineered to operate using a number of different process configurations, as batch or continuous, mesophilic, high solid or low solid, and single stage or multistage range: String Example: None samp_salinity OPT Description: Salinity is the total concentration of all dissolved salts in a liquid or solid (in the form of an extract obtained by centrifugation) sample. While salinity can be measured by a complete chemical analysis, this method is difficult and time consuming. More often, it is instead derived from the conductivity measurement. This is known as practical salinity. These derivations compare the specific conductance of the sample to a salinity standard such as seawater range: String Example: 1 milligram per liter None samp_store_dur OPT Description: Duration for which the sample was stored range: String Example: P1Y6M None samp_store_loc OPT Description: Location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room range: String Example: Freezer no:5 None samp_store_temp OPT Description: Temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80 degree Celsius range: String Example: -80 degree Celsius None samp_vol_we_dna_ext OPT Description: Volume (ml), weight (g) of processed sample, or surface area swabbed from sample for DNA extraction range: String Example: 1500 milliliter None secondary_treatment OPT Description: The process for substantially degrading the biological content of the sewage range: String Example: None sewage_type OPT Description: Type of wastewater treatment plant as municipial or industrial range: String Example: None sludge_retent_time OPT Description: The time activated sludge remains in reactor range: String Example: None sodium OPT Description: Sodium concentration in the sample range: String Example: 10.5 milligram per liter None soluble_inorg_mat OPT Description: Concentration of substances such as ammonia, road-salt, sea-salt, cyanide, hydrogen sulfide, thiocyanates, thiosulfates, etc. range: String Example: None soluble_org_mat OPT Description: Concentration of substances such as urea, fruit sugars, soluble proteins, drugs, pharmaceuticals, etc. range: String Example: None suspend_solids OPT Description: Concentration of substances including a wide variety of material, such as silt, decaying plant and animal matter; can include multiple substances range: String Example: None temp OPT Description: Temperature of the sample at the time of sampling range: String Example: 25 degree Celsius None tertiary_treatment OPT Description: The process providing a final treatment stage to raise the effluent quality before it is discharged to the receiving environment range: String Example: None tot_nitro OPT Description: Total nitrogen concentration of water samples, calculated by: total nitrogen = total dissolved nitrogen + particulate nitrogen. Can also be measured without filtering, reported as nitrogen range: String Example: 50 micromole per liter None tot_phosphate OPT Description: Total amount or concentration of phosphate range: String Example: None wastewater_type OPT Description: The origin of wastewater such as human waste, rainfall, storm drains, etc. range: String Example: None

docs.text: alkalinity OPT Description: Alkalinity, the ability of a solution to neutralize acids to the equivalence point of carbonate or bicarbonate range: String Example: 50 milligram per liter None biochem_oxygen_dem OPT Description: Amount of dissolved oxygen needed by aerobic biological organisms in a body of water to break down organic material present in a given water sample at certain temperature over a specific time period range: String Example: None chem_administration OPT Description: List of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. Antibiotics, n fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For chemical entities of biological interest ontology (chebi) (v 163), http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/chebi range: String Example: agar [CHEBI:2509];2018-05-11T20:00Z None chem_oxygen_dem OPT Description: A measure of the capacity of water to consume oxygen during the decomposition of organic matter and the oxidation of inorganic chemicals such as ammonia and nitrite range: String Example: None efficiency_percent OPT Description: Percentage of volatile solids removed from the anaerobic digestor range: String Example: None emulsions OPT Description: Amount or concentration of substances such as paints, adhesives, mayonnaise, hair colorants, emulsified oils, etc.; can include multiple emulsion types range: String Example: None gaseous_substances OPT Description: Amount or concentration of substances such as hydrogen sulfide, carbon dioxide, methane, etc.; can include multiple substances range: String Example: None indust_eff_percent OPT Description: Percentage of industrial effluents received by wastewater treatment plant range: String Example: None inorg_particles OPT Description: Concentration of particles such as sand, grit, metal particles, ceramics, etc.; can include multiple particles range: String Example: None misc_param OPT Description: Any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here range: String Example: Bicarbonate ion concentration;2075 micromole per kilogram None nitrate OPT Description: Concentration of nitrate in the sample range: String Example: 65 micromole per liter None org_particles OPT Description: Concentration of particles such as faeces, hairs, food, vomit, paper fibers, plant material, humus, etc. range: String Example: None organism_count OPT Description: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) Should also be provided. (example: total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qpcr) range: String Example: total prokaryotes;3.5e7 cells per milliliter;qPCR None oxy_stat_samp OPT Description: Oxygenation status of sample range: String Example: aerobic None perturbation OPT Description: Type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with perturbation regimen including how many times the perturbation was repeated, how long each perturbation lasted, and the start and end time of the entire perturbation period; can include multiple perturbation types range: String Example: antibiotic addition;R2/2018-05-11T14:30Z/2018-05-11T19:30Z/P1H30M None ph OPT Description: Ph measurement of the sample, or liquid portion of sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid range: String Example: 7.2 None phosphate OPT Description: Concentration of phosphate range: String Example: 0.7 micromole per liter None pre_treatment OPT Description: The process of pre-treatment removes materials that can be easily collected from the raw wastewater range: String Example: None primary_treatment OPT Description: The process to produce both a generally homogeneous liquid capable of being treated biologically and a sludge that can be separately treated or processed range: String Example: None reactor_type OPT Description: Anaerobic digesters can be designed and engineered to operate using a number of different process configurations, as batch or continuous, mesophilic, high solid or low solid, and single stage or multistage range: String Example: None samp_salinity OPT Description: Salinity is the total concentration of all dissolved salts in a liquid or solid (in the form of an extract obtained by centrifugation) sample. While salinity can be measured by a complete chemical analysis, this method is difficult and time consuming. More often, it is instead derived from the conductivity measurement. This is known as practical salinity. These derivations compare the specific conductance of the sample to a salinity standard such as seawater range: String Example: 1 milligram per liter None samp_store_dur OPT Description: Duration for which the sample was stored range: String Example: P1Y6M None samp_store_loc OPT Description: Location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room range: String Example: Freezer no:5 None samp_store_temp OPT Description: Temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80 degree Celsius range: String Example: -80 degree Celsius None samp_vol_we_dna_ext OPT Description: Volume (ml), weight (g) of processed sample, or surface area swabbed from sample for DNA extraction range: String Example: 1500 milliliter None secondary_treatment OPT Description: The process for substantially degrading the biological content of the sewage range: String Example: None sewage_type OPT Description: Type of wastewater treatment plant as municipial or industrial range: String Example: None sludge_retent_time OPT Description: The time activated sludge remains in reactor range: String Example: None sodium OPT Description: Sodium concentration in the sample range: String Example: 10.5 milligram per liter None soluble_inorg_mat OPT Description: Concentration of substances such as ammonia, road-salt, sea-salt, cyanide, hydrogen sulfide, thiocyanates, thiosulfates, etc. range: String Example: None soluble_org_mat OPT Description: Concentration of substances such as urea, fruit sugars, soluble proteins, drugs, pharmaceuticals, etc. range: String Example: None suspend_solids OPT Description: Concentration of substances including a wide variety of material, such as silt, decaying plant and animal matter; can include multiple substances range: String Example: None temp OPT Description: Temperature of the sample at the time of sampling range: String Example: 25 degree Celsius None tertiary_treatment OPT Description: The process providing a final treatment stage to raise the effluent quality before it is discharged to the receiving environment range: String Example: None tot_nitro OPT Description: Total nitrogen concentration of water samples, calculated by: total nitrogen = total dissolved nitrogen + particulate nitrogen. Can also be measured without filtering, reported as nitrogen range: String Example: 50 micromole per liter None tot_phosphate OPT Description: Total amount or concentration of phosphate range: String Example: None wastewater_type OPT Description: The origin of wastewater such as human waste, rainfall, storm drains, etc. range: String Example: None
