docs.text: Type: water water URI: mixs.vocab:Water Attributes Own alkalinity OPT Description: Alkalinity, the ability of a solution to neutralize acids to the equivalence point of carbonate or bicarbonate range: String Example: 50 milligram per liter None alkalinity_method OPT Description: Method used for alkalinity measurement range: String Example: titration None alkyl_diethers OPT Description: Concentration of alkyl diethers range: String Example: 0.005 mole per liter None aminopept_act OPT Description: Measurement of aminopeptidase activity range: String Example: 0.269 mole per liter per hour None ammonium OPT Description: Concentration of ammonium in the sample range: String Example: 1.5 milligram per liter None atmospheric_data OPT Description: Measurement of atmospheric data; can include multiple data range: String Example: wind speed;9 knots None bac_prod OPT Description: Bacterial production in the water column measured by isotope uptake range: String Example: 5 milligram per cubic meter per day None bac_resp OPT Description: Measurement of bacterial respiration in the water column range: String Example: 300 micromole oxygen per liter per hour None bacteria_carb_prod OPT Description: Measurement of bacterial carbon production range: String Example: 2.53 microgram per liter per hour None biomass OPT Description: Amount of biomass; should include the name for the part of biomass measured, e.g. Microbial, total. Can include multiple measurements range: String Example: total;20 gram None bishomohopanol OPT Description: Concentration of bishomohopanol range: String Example: 14 microgram per liter None bromide OPT Description: Concentration of bromide range: String Example: 0.05 parts per million None calcium OPT Description: Concentration of calcium in the sample range: String Example: 0.2 micromole per liter None carb_nitro_ratio OPT Description: Ratio of amount or concentrations of carbon to nitrogen range: String Example: 0.417361111 None chem_administration OPT Description: List of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. Antibiotics, n fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For chemical entities of biological interest ontology (chebi) (v 163), http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/chebi range: String Example: agar [CHEBI:2509];2018-05-11T20:00Z None chloride OPT Description: Concentration of chloride in the sample range: String Example: 5000 milligram per liter None chlorophyll OPT Description: Concentration of chlorophyll range: String Example: 5 milligram per cubic meter None conduc OPT Description: Electrical conductivity of water range: String Example: 10 milliSiemens per centimeter None density OPT Description: Density of the sample, which is its mass per unit volume (aka volumetric mass density) range: String Example: 1000 kilogram per cubic meter None diether_lipids OPT Description: Concentration of diether lipids; can include multiple types of diether lipids range: String Example: 0.2 nanogram per liter None diss_carb_dioxide OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved carbon dioxide in the sample or liquid portion of the sample range: String Example: 5 milligram per liter None diss_hydrogen OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved hydrogen range: String Example: 0.3 micromole per liter None diss_inorg_carb OPT Description: Dissolved inorganic carbon concentration in the sample, typically measured after filtering the sample using a 0.45 micrometer filter range: String Example: 2059 micromole per kilogram None diss_inorg_nitro OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved inorganic nitrogen range: String Example: 761 micromole per liter None diss_inorg_phosp OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved inorganic phosphorus in the sample range: String Example: 56.5 micromole per liter None diss_org_carb OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved organic carbon in the sample, liquid portion of the sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid range: String Example: 197 micromole per liter None diss_org_nitro OPT Description: Dissolved organic nitrogen concentration measured as; total dissolved nitrogen - NH4 - NO3 - NO2 range: String Example: 0.05 micromole per liter None diss_oxygen OPT Description: Concentration of dissolved oxygen range: String Example: 175 micromole per kilogram None down_par OPT Description: Visible waveband radiance and irradiance measurements in the water column range: String Example: 28.71 microEinstein per square meter per second None fluor OPT Description: Raw or converted fluorescence of water range: String Example: 2.5 volts None glucosidase_act OPT Description: Measurement of glucosidase activity range: String Example: 5 mol per liter per hour None light_intensity OPT Description: Measurement of light intensity range: String Example: 0.3 lux None magnesium OPT Description: Concentration of magnesium in the sample range: String Example: 52.8 micromole per kilogram None mean_frict_vel OPT Description: Measurement of mean friction velocity range: String Example: 0.5 meter per second None mean_peak_frict_vel OPT Description: Measurement of mean peak friction velocity range: String Example: 1 meter per second None misc_param OPT Description: Any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here range: String Example: Bicarbonate ion concentration;2075 micromole per kilogram None n_alkanes OPT Description: Concentration of n-alkanes; can include multiple n-alkanes range: String Example: n-hexadecane;100 milligram per liter None nitrate OPT Description: Concentration of nitrate in the sample range: String Example: 65 micromole per liter None nitrite OPT Description: Concentration of nitrite in the sample range: String Example: 0.5 micromole per liter None nitro OPT Description: Concentration of nitrogen (total) range: String Example: 4.2 micromole per liter None org_carb OPT Description: Concentration of organic carbon range: String Example: 1.5 microgram per liter None org_matter OPT Description: Concentration of organic matter range: String Example: 1.75 milligram per cubic meter None org_nitro OPT Description: Concentration of organic nitrogen range: String Example: 4 micromole per liter None organism_count OPT Description: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) Should also be provided. (example: total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qpcr) range: String Example: total prokaryotes;3.5e7 cells per milliliter;qPCR None oxy_stat_samp OPT Description: Oxygenation status of sample range: String Example: aerobic None part_org_carb OPT Description: Concentration of particulate organic carbon range: String Example: 1.92 micromole per liter None part_org_nitro OPT Description: Concentration of particulate organic nitrogen range: String Example: 0.3 micromole per liter None perturbation OPT Description: Type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with perturbation regimen including how many times the perturbation was repeated, how long each perturbation lasted, and the start and end time of the entire perturbation period; can include multiple perturbation types range: String Example: antibiotic addition;R2/2018-05-11T14:30Z/2018-05-11T19:30Z/P1H30M None petroleum_hydrocarb OPT Description: Concentration of petroleum hydrocarbon range: String Example: 0.05 micromole per liter None ph OPT Description: Ph measurement of the sample, or liquid portion of sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid range: String Example: 7.2 None phaeopigments OPT Description: Concentration of phaeopigments; can include multiple phaeopigments range: String Example: 2.5 milligram per cubic meter None phosphate OPT Description: Concentration of phosphate range: String Example: 0.7 micromole per liter None phosplipid_fatt_acid OPT Description: Concentration of phospholipid fatty acids; can include multiple values range: String Example: 2.98 milligram per liter None photon_flux OPT Description: Measurement of photon flux range: String Example: 3.926 micromole photons per second per square meter None potassium OPT Description: Concentration of potassium in the sample range: String Example: 463 milligram per liter None pressure OPT Description: Pressure to which the sample is subject to, in atmospheres range: String Example: 50 atmosphere None primary_prod OPT Description: Measurement of primary production, generally measured as isotope uptake range: String Example: 100 milligram per cubic meter per day None redox_potential OPT Description: Redox potential, measured relative to a hydrogen cell, indicating oxidation or reduction potential range: String Example: 300 millivolt None salinity OPT Description: Salinity is the total concentration of all dissolved salts in a water sample. While salinity can be measured by a complete chemical analysis, this method is difficult and time consuming. More often, it is instead derived from the conductivity measurement. This is known as practical salinity. These derivations compare the specific conductance of the sample to a salinity standard such as seawater range: String Example: 25 practical salinity unit None samp_store_dur OPT Description: Duration for which the sample was stored range: String Example: P1Y6M None samp_store_loc OPT Description: Location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room range: String Example: Freezer no:5 None samp_store_temp OPT Description: Temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80 degree Celsius range: String Example: -80 degree Celsius None samp_vol_we_dna_ext OPT Description: Volume (ml), weight (g) of processed sample, or surface area swabbed from sample for DNA extraction range: String Example: 1500 milliliter None silicate OPT Description: Concentration of silicate range: String Example: 0.05 micromole per liter None size_frac_low OPT Description: Refers to the mesh/pore size used to pre-filter/pre-sort the sample. Materials larger than the size threshold are excluded from the sample range: String Example: 0.2 micrometer None size_frac_up OPT Description: Refers to the mesh/pore size used to retain the sample. Materials smaller than the size threshold are excluded from the sample range: String Example: 20 micrometer None sodium OPT Description: Sodium concentration in the sample range: String Example: 10.5 milligram per liter None soluble_react_phosp OPT Description: Concentration of soluble reactive phosphorus range: String Example: 0.1 milligram per liter None sulfate OPT Description: Concentration of sulfate in the sample range: String Example: 5 micromole per liter None sulfide OPT Description: Concentration of sulfide in the sample range: String Example: 2 micromole per liter None suspend_part_matter OPT Description: Concentration of suspended particulate matter range: String Example: 0.5 milligram per liter None temp OPT Description: Temperature of the sample at the time of sampling range: String Example: 25 degree Celsius None tidal_stage OPT Description: Stage of tide range: String Example: high tide None tot_depth_water_col OPT Description: Measurement of total depth of water column range: String Example: 500 meter None tot_diss_nitro OPT Description: Total dissolved nitrogen concentration, reported as nitrogen, measured by: total dissolved nitrogen = NH4 + NO3NO2 + dissolved organic nitrogen range: String Example: 40 microgram per liter None tot_inorg_nitro OPT Description: Total inorganic nitrogen content range: String Example: 40 microgram per liter None tot_nitro OPT Description: Total nitrogen concentration of water samples, calculated by: total nitrogen = total dissolved nitrogen + particulate nitrogen. Can also be measured without filtering, reported as nitrogen range: String Example: 50 micromole per liter None tot_part_carb OPT Description: Total particulate carbon content range: String Example: 35 micromole per liter None tot_phosp OPT Description: Total phosphorus concentration in the sample, calculated by: total phosphorus = total dissolved phosphorus + particulate phosphorus range: String Example: 0.03 milligram per liter None turbidity OPT Description: Measure of the amount of cloudiness or haziness in water caused by individual particles range: String Example: 0.3 nephelometric turbidity units None water_current OPT Description: Measurement of magnitude and direction of flow within a fluid range: String Example: 10 cubic meter per second None

docs.text: Type: alt Altitude is a term used to identify heights of objects such as airplanes, space shuttles, rockets, atmospheric balloons and heights of places such as atmospheric layers and clouds. It is used to measure the height of an object which is above the earth‚Äôs surface. docs.text: Type: assembly_qual The assembly quality category is based on sets of criteria outlined for each assembly quality category. For MISAG/MIMAG; Finished: Single, validated, contiguous sequence per replicon without gaps or ambiguities with a consensus error rate equivalent to Q50 or better. High Quality Draft:Multiple fragments where gaps span repetitive regions. Presence of the 23S, 16S and 5S rRNA genes and at least 18 tRNAs. Medium Quality Draft:Many fragments with little to no review of assembly other than reporting of standard assembly statistics. Low Quality Draft:Many fragments with little to no review of assembly other than reporting of standard assembly statistics. Assembly statistics include, but are not limited to total assembly size, number of contigs, contig N50/L50, and maximum contig length. For MIUVIG; Finished: Single, validated, contiguous sequence per replicon without gaps or ambiguities, with extensive manual review and editing to annotate putative gene functions and transcriptional units. High-quality draft genome: One or multiple fragments, totaling ≥ 90% of the expected genome or replicon sequence or predicted complete. Genome fragment(s): One or multiple fragments, totalling < 90% of the expected genome or replicon sequence, or for which no genome size could be estimated URI: mixs.vocab:assembly_qual Domain and Range None -> OPT String Parents is_a: sequencing field Children Used by Core Other properties Aliases: assembly quality Comments: Expected value: enumeration Preferred unit: Position: 54.0 Examples: Example(value='High-quality draft genome', description=None)
docs.title: Type: assembly_qual

Medium Quality Draft:Many fragments with little to no review of assembly other than reporting of standard assembly statistics. Assembly statistics include, but are not limited to total assembly size, number of contigs, contig N50/L50, and maximum contig length. High-quality draft genome: One or multiple fragments, totaling ≥ 90% of the expected genome or replicon sequence or predicted complete. Genome fragment(s): One or multiple fragments, totalling < 90% of the expected genome or replicon sequence, or for which no genome size could be estimated URI: mixs.vocab:assembly_qual

docs.text: Type: chimera_check A chimeric sequence, or chimera for short, is a sequence comprised of two or more phylogenetically distinct parent sequences. Chimeras are usually PCR artifacts thought to occur when a prematurely terminated amplicon reanneals to a foreign DNA strand and is copied to completion in the following PCR cycles. The point at which the chimeric sequence changes from one parent to the next is called the breakpoint or conversion point URI: mixs.vocab:chimera_check Domain and Range None -> OPT String Parents is_a: sequencing field Children Used by Core Other properties Aliases: chimera check Comments: Expected value: name and version of software, parameters used Preferred unit: Position: 52.0 Examples: Example(value='uchime;v4.1;default parameters', description=None)
docs.title: Type: chimera_check

docs.text: A chimeric sequence, or chimera for short, is a sequence comprised of two or more phylogenetically distinct parent sequences. The point at which the chimeric sequence changes from one parent to the next is called the breakpoint or conversion point URI: mixs.vocab:chimera_check

docs.text: Type: collection_date The time of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. docs.text: Type: contam_score The contamination score is based on the fraction of single-copy genes that are observed more than once in a query genome. The following scores are acceptable for; High Quality Draft: < 5%, Medium Quality Draft: < 10%, Low Quality Draft: < 10%. Contamination must be below 5% for a SAG or MAG to be deposited into any of the public databases URI: mixs.vocab:contam_score Domain and Range None -> OPT String Parents is_a: sequencing field Children Used by Core Other properties Aliases: contamination score Comments: Expected value: value Preferred unit: Position: 70.0 Examples: Example(value='1%', description=None)

docs.text: Type: env_broad_scale In this field, report which major environmental system your sample or specimen came from. The systems identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. were you in the desert or a rainforest?). We recommend using subclasses of ENVO’s biome class: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000428. Format (one term): termLabel [termID], Format (multiple terms): termLabel [termID]|termLabel [termID]|termLabel [termID]. Example: Annotating a water sample from the photic zone in middle of the Atlantic Ocean, consider: oceanic epipelagic zone biome [ENVO:01000033]. Example: Annotating a sample from the Amazon rainforest consider: tropical moist broadleaf forest biome [ENVO:01000228]. If needed, request new terms on the ENVO tracker, identified here: http://www.obofoundry.org/ontology/envo.html URI: mixs.vocab:env_broad_scale Domain and Range None -> OPT String Parents is_a: environment field Children Used by Core Other properties Aliases: broad-scale environmental context Comments: Expected value: Add terms that identify the major environment type(s) where your sample was collected. Recommend subclasses of biome [ENVO:00000428]. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes e.g.: mangrove biome [ENVO:01000181] Preferred unit: Position: 10.0 Examples: Example(value='forest biome [ENVO:01000174]', description=None)
docs.title: Type: env_broad_scale

docs.text: Type: env_local_scale In this field, report the entity or entities which are in your sample or specimen’s local vicinity and which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample or specimen. Please use terms that are present in ENVO and which are of smaller spatial grain than your entry for env_broad_scale. Format (one term): termLabel [termID]; Format (multiple terms): termLabel [termID]|termLabel [termID]|termLabel [termID]. Example: Annotating a pooled sample taken from various vegetation layers in a forest consider: canopy [ENVO:00000047]|herb and fern layer [ENVO:01000337]|litter layer [ENVO:01000338]|understory [01000335]|shrub layer [ENVO:01000336]. If needed, request new terms on the ENVO tracker, identified here: http://www.obofoundry.org/ontology/envo.html URI: mixs.vocab:env_local_scale Domain and Range None -> OPT String Parents is_a: environment field Children Used by Core Other properties Aliases: local environmental context Comments: Expected value: Add terms that identify environmental entities having causal influences upon the entity at time of sampling, multiple terms can be separated by pipes, e.g.: shoreline [ENVO:00000486] Preferred unit: Position: 11.0 Examples: Example(value='litter layer [ENVO:01000338]', description=None)
docs.title: Type: env_local_scale

docs.text: In this field, report the entity or entities which are in your sample or specimen’s local vicinity and which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample or specimen. Please use terms that are present in ENVO and which are of smaller spatial grain than your entry for env_broad_scale. Format (one term): termLabel [termID]; Format (multiple terms): termLabel [termID]|termLabel [termID]|termLabel [termID]. Example: Annotating a pooled sample taken from various vegetation layers in a forest consider: canopy [ENVO:00000047]|herb and fern layer [ENVO:01000337]|litter layer [ENVO:01000338]|understory [01000335]|shrub layer [ENVO:01000336]. If needed, request new terms on the ENVO tracker, identified here: http://www.obofoundry.org/ontology/envo.html URI: mixs.vocab:env_local_scale

docs.text: Type: env_medium In this field, report which environmental material or materials (pipe separated) immediately surrounded your sample or specimen prior to sampling, using one or more subclasses of ENVO’s environmental material class: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483. Format (one term): termLabel [termID]; Format (multiple terms): termLabel [termID]|termLabel [termID]|termLabel [termID]. Example: Annotating a fish swimming in the upper 100 m of the Atlantic Ocean, consider: ocean water [ENVO:00002151]. Example: Annotating a duck on a pond consider: pond water [ENVO:00002228]|air ENVO_00002005. If needed, request new terms on the ENVO tracker, identified here: http://www.obofoundry.org/ontology/envo.html URI: mixs.vocab:env_medium Domain and Range None -> OPT String Parents is_a: environment field Children Used by Core Other properties Aliases: environmental medium Comments: Expected value: Add terms that identify the material displaced by the entity at time of sampling. Recommend subclasses of environmental material [ENVO:00010483]. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes e.g.: estuarine water [ENVO:01000301] Preferred unit: Position: 12.0 Examples: Example(value='soil [ENVO:00001998]', description=None)

docs.text: Type: experimental_factor Experimental factors are essentially the variable aspects of an experiment design which can be used to describe an experiment, or set of experiments, in an increasingly detailed manner. This field accepts ontology terms from Experimental Factor Ontology (EFO) and/or Ontology for Biomedical Investigations (OBI). For a browser of EFO (v 2.95) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/EFO; for a browser of OBI (v 2018-02-12) terms please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/OBI URI: mixs.vocab:experimental_factor Domain and Range None -> OPT String Parents is_a: investigation field Children Used by Core Other properties Aliases: experimental factor Comments: Expected value: text or EFO and/or OBI Preferred unit: Position: 4.0 Examples: Example(value='time series design [EFO:EFO_0001779]', description=None)

docs.text: Type: hcr Main Hydrocarbon Resource type. The term "Hydrocarbon Resource" HCR defined as a natural environmental feature containing large amounts of hydrocarbons at high concentrations potentially suitable for commercial exploitation. This term should not be confused with the Hydrocarbon Occurrence term which also includes hydrocarbon-rich environments with currently limited commercial interest such as seeps, outcrops, gas hydrates etc. If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field URI: mixs.vocab:hcr Domain and Range None -> OPT String Parents is_a: environment field Children Used by HydrocarbonResources-cores HydrocarbonResources-fluidsSwabs Other properties Aliases: hydrocarbon resource type Mappings: MIXS:0000988 Comments: Expected value: enumeration Preferred unit: Occurrence: 1 Position: 1 This field is used in: 2 packages: hydrocarbon resources-cores, hydrocarbon resources-fluids_swabs Examples: Example(value='Oil Sand', description=None)

docs.text: Type: ploidy The ploidy level of the genome (e.g. allopolyploid, haploid, diploid, triploid, tetraploid). It has implications for the downstream study of duplicated gene and regions of the genomes (and perhaps for difficulties in assembly). For terms, please select terms listed under class ploidy (PATO:001374) of Phenotypic Quality Ontology (PATO), and for a browser of PATO (v 2018-03-27) please refer to http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO URI: mixs.vocab:ploidy Domain and Range None -> OPT String Parents is_a: nucleic acid sequence source field Children Used by Core Other properties Aliases: ploidy Comments: Expected value: PATO Preferred unit: Position: 15.0 Examples: Example(value='allopolyploidy [PATO:0001379]', description=None)

docs.text: Type: resins_pc Saturate, Aromatic, Resin and Asphaltene¬†(SARA) is an analysis method that divides¬†crude oil¬†components according to their polarizability and polarity. docs.text: Type: salinity Salinity is the total concentration of all dissolved salts in a water sample. While salinity can be measured by a complete chemical analysis, this method is difficult and time consuming. More often, it is instead derived from the conductivity measurement. This is known as practical salinity. These derivations compare the specific conductance of the sample to a salinity standard such as seawater URI: mixs.vocab:salinity Domain and Range None -> OPT String Parents is_a: environment field Children Used by MicrobialMatBiofilm MiscellaneousNaturalOrArtificialEnvironment Sediment Water Other properties Aliases: salinity Mappings: MIXS:0000183 Comments: Expected value: measurement value Preferred unit: practical salinity unit, percentage Occurrence: 1 Position: 1 This field is used in: 4 packages: microbial mat_biofilm, miscellaneous natural or artificial environment, sediment, water Examples: Example(value='25 practical salinity unit', description=None)
docs.title: Type: salinity

docs.text: Type: samp_loc_corr_rate Metal corrosion rate is the speed of metal deterioration due to environmental conditions. As environmental conditions change corrosion rates change accordingly. Therefore, long term corrosion rates are generally more informative than short term rates and for that reason they are preferred during reporting. In the case of suspected MIC, corrosion rate measurements at the time of sampling might provide insights into the involvement of certain microbial community members in MIC as well as potential microbial interplays URI: mixs.vocab:samp_loc_corr_rate Domain and Range None -> OPT String Parents is_a: environment field Children Used by HydrocarbonResources-fluidsSwabs Other properties Aliases: corrosion rate at sample location Mappings: MIXS:0000136 Comments: Expected value: measurement value range Preferred unit: millimeter per year Occurrence: 1 Position: 34 This field is used uniquely in: hydrocarbon resources-fluids_swabs Examples: Example(value='', description=None)
docs.title: Type: samp_loc_corr_rate

docs.text: Type: samp_md In non deviated well, measured depth is equal to the true vertical depth, TVD (TVD=TVDSS plus the reference or datum it refers to). In deviated wells, the MD is the length of trajectory of the borehole measured from the same reference or datum. Common datums used are ground level (GL), drilling rig floor (DF), rotary table (RT), kelly bushing (KB) and mean sea level (MSL). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field URI: mixs.vocab:samp_md Domain and Range None -> OPT String Parents is_a: environment field Children Used by HydrocarbonResources-cores Other properties Aliases: sample measured depth Mappings: MIXS:0000413 Comments: Expected value: measurement value;enumeration Preferred unit: meter Occurrence: 1 Position: 43 This field is used uniquely in: hydrocarbon resources-cores Examples: Example(value='1534 meter;MSL', description=None)
docs.title: Type: samp_md

docs.text: In non deviated well, measured depth is equal to the true vertical depth, TVD (TVD=TVDSS plus the reference or datum it refers to). docs.text: Type: samp_salinity Salinity is the total concentration of all dissolved salts in a liquid or solid (in the form of an extract obtained by centrifugation) sample. While salinity can be measured by a complete chemical analysis, this method is difficult and time consuming. More often, it is instead derived from the conductivity measurement. This is known as practical salinity. These derivations compare the specific conductance of the sample to a salinity standard such as seawater URI: mixs.vocab:samp_salinity Domain and Range None -> OPT String Parents is_a: environment field Children Used by Air Host-associated Human-associated Human-gut Human-oral Human-skin Human-vaginal HydrocarbonResources-cores HydrocarbonResources-fluidsSwabs Plant-associated WastewaterSludge Other properties Aliases: sample salinity Mappings: MIXS:0000109 Comments: Expected value: measurement value Preferred unit: milligram per liter, practical salinity unit, percentage Occurrence: 1 Position: 1 This field is used in: 11 packages: air, host-associated, human-associated, human-gut, human-oral, human-skin, human-vaginal, hydrocarbon resources-cores, hydrocarbon resources-fluids_swabs, plant-associated, wastewater_sludge Examples: Example(value='1 milligram per liter', description=None)
docs.title: Type: samp_salinity

docs.text: Type: saturates_pc Saturate, Aromatic, Resin and Asphaltene¬†(SARA) is an analysis method that divides¬†crude oil¬†components according to their polarizability and polarity. There are three main methods to obtain SARA results. The most popular one is known as the Iatroscan TLC-FID and is referred to as IP-143 (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturate,_aromatic,_resin_and_asphaltene) URI: mixs.vocab:saturates_pc Domain and Range None -> OPT String Parents is_a: environment field Children Used by HydrocarbonResources-cores HydrocarbonResources-fluidsSwabs Other properties Aliases: saturates wt% Mappings: MIXS:0000131 Comments: Expected value: name;measurement value Preferred unit: percent Occurrence: 1 Position: 89 This field is used in: 2 packages: hydrocarbon resources-cores, hydrocarbon resources-fluids_swabs Examples: Example(value='', description=None)

docs.text: Type: source_mat_id A unique identifier assigned to a material sample (as defined by http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/materialSampleID, and as opposed to a particular digital record of a material sample) used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. The INSDC qualifiers /specimen_voucher, /bio_material, or /culture_collection may or may not share the same value as the source_mat_id field. For instance, the /specimen_voucher qualifier and source_mat_id may both contain 'UAM:Herps:14' , referring to both the specimen voucher and sampled tissue with the same identifier. However, the /culture_collection qualifier may refer to a value from an initial culture (e.g. ATCC:11775) while source_mat_id would refer to an identifier from some derived culture from which the nucleic acids were extracted (e.g. xatc123 or ark:/2154/R2). URI: mixs.vocab:source_mat_id Domain and Range None -> OPT String Parents is_a: nucleic acid sequence source field Children Used by Core Other properties Aliases: source material identifiers Comments: Expected value: for cultures of microorganisms: identifiers for two culture collections; for other material a unique arbitrary identifer Preferred unit: Position: 20.0 Examples: Example(value='MPI012345', description=None)
docs.title: Type: source_mat_id

docs.text: A unique identifier assigned to a material sample (as defined by http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/materialSampleID, and as opposed to a particular digital record of a material sample) used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. The INSDC qualifiers /specimen_voucher, /bio_material, or /culture_collection may or may not share the same value as the source_mat_id field. For instance, the /specimen_voucher qualifier and source_mat_id may both contain 'UAM:Herps:14' , referring to both the specimen voucher and sampled tissue with the same identifier. However, the /culture_collection qualifier may refer to a value from an initial culture (e.g. ATCC:11775) while source_mat_id would refer to an identifier from some derived culture from which the nucleic acids were extracted (e.g. xatc123 or ark:/2154/R2). URI: mixs.vocab:source_mat_id
docs.title: Type: source_mat_id

docs.text: Type: submitted_to_insdc Depending on the study (large-scale e.g. done with next generation sequencing technology, or small-scale) sequences have to be submitted to SRA (Sequence Read Archive), DRA (DDBJ Read Archive) or via the classical Webin/Sequin systems to Genbank, ENA and DDBJ. Although this field is mandatory, it is meant as a self-test field, therefore it is not necessary to include this field in contextual data submitted to databases URI: mixs.vocab:submitted_to_insdc Domain and Range None -> OPT String Parents is_a: investigation field Children Used by Core Other properties Aliases: submitted to insdc Comments: Expected value: boolean Preferred unit: Position: 1.0 Examples: Example(value='yes', description=None)

docs.text: Type: subspecf_gen_lin This should provide further information about the genetic distinctness of the sequenced organism by recording additional information e.g. serovar, serotype, biotype, ecotype, or any relevant genetic typing schemes like Group I plasmid. It can also contain alternative taxonomic information. It should contain both the lineage name, and the lineage rank, i.e. biovar:abc123 URI: mixs.vocab:subspecf_gen_lin Domain and Range None -> OPT String Parents is_a: nucleic acid sequence source field Children Used by Core Other properties Aliases: subspecific genetic lineage Comments: Expected value: genetic lineage below lowest rank of NCBI taxonomy, which is subspecies, e.g. serovar, biotype, ecotype Preferred unit: Position: 14.0 Examples: Example(value='serovar:Newport', description=None)
